title: Anticipate and Excite
text:
Remember meeting new people? Crushes? Not being able to concentrate because you can't get him out of your head? Remember "accidental" touches under the table or while walking next to each other? Your heart beating faster. I've been thinking about those things a lot lately.

I won't lie. I'm married and you are married too. We will understand each other in a way that others wouldn't. Maybe like me, you started off thinking about having a friend to confide in and talk to. And the more you thought about it, the more you realized that you're here looking for a friend who will truly add something to your life. You decided that you're taking a chance, accepting the risk. So maybe it's not only about friendship.

I want great conversation, laughs, sharing. The truth is, though, that if I'm really honest with myself, I hope that friendship will spark some feelings that I've been missing. I'm looking for the anticipation and excitement that I recall having once upon a time. I want the flutters and the tingles. I'm looking for adventure. So maybe we'll call it friends with potential.

If you're smart, flirty, a little adventurous and take good care of yourself, we'll be starting off with a few important things in common. Then . . . who knows? Let's take a chance. Not into big women... you look good and are in great shape. I can match that.

title: If Einstein had a donkey
text:
In the interest of full disclosure, I'm a single white divorced white male with sometimes-spiky hair and green eyes. I don't love math. Getting that out of the way. I enjoy long walks on the beach and underwater basket weaving on occasion.

I work too much, I'm a huge asshole, I smoke too much, and I swear and say inappropriate things too damn much. But deep down inside I'm really a caring, nicotine-free (just stopped), intelligent, sweet, sensual, hardworking man. Or something like that, I couldn't think of any more lovely adjectives.

I'm hoping through all this I can just go dating and see what happens from there. I'm not looking for anything in particular relationship-wise, because I think that sets my expectations too high. What can I say? I like all kinds of women. I prefer brunettes as well as women who are pretty, engaging, sensual, and toned bodies with nice breasts. Toned bodies and nice breasts are the new black.

I have requirements, though. I can hear all you prospective women saying "this guy is crazy." So don't worry, you don't have to tell me.

-Be emotionally stable. Additionally, with some exceptions, if you take more pills in ONE day than I take in ONE week, you need not apply. Especially if said drugs end in -ine or --pram.

-Be somewhat smart, cultured and moxie filled. I'd also like someone who keeps up with the news and things going on. If you enjoy all aspects of the New York Times you pass this section.

-Adding to the previous dashed item, if you're looking for a yes-man or a sweetie poo who listen to you all the time, leave. . . Now! I do have tact, and I do have very good listening skills, and I'm pretty damn good at understanding and making women feel better when things are wrong. However, I keep it real, almost painfully real. That doesn't mean that will happen all the time; I'm human too, I have issues, I can't go around consoling and saying yes and not keep it real all of the damn time.

-Have some sort of main goal that doesn't involve drinking heavily, addictive shopping, or laying on the cake i.e., too much make-up. I've done two of those before (you're right, I'm not a cross dresser), but they're not my main goal in life. If it was, I'd be with my Indian friend going to Napa, or I'd be passed out in the bay clutching a 40. 

-On the other hand, don't be so goal oriented that you're a crazy overachieving she-beast. No one likes to the overachiever, or the person with a billion goals! I have a few goals, yes, but I still have big gaping question marks running around my head.


I may be posting on here, but I'm not desperate, nor do I want to go into jail or play the role of Cabana Boy to an older woman. Wait. Maybe I should reconsider that. . .

Wow. I didn't expect my requirements to go longer than information about myself. Oops. Oh, yeah, your pic gets mine. 

50-58

title: Movie Theater fantasy? Join me for a memorable evening of "viewing"
text:
I'm sure you've been sitting through a boring film and thought to yourself "I sure wish I had someone to fool around with right about now."

I've often thought the same thing, and having indulged in this a few times I can attest that it often exceeds the fantasy.

Now let me be clear, I have no desire to be hauled into the police station for lewd acts in public. Part of the appeal for me is doing this on the down low. 

So, here is how I imagine this. We talk online. We exchange photos so we don't accidentally go feeling up some unsuspecting stranger and assuming there's mutual chemistry, we make a date for a movie theater rendezvous.

I'm partial to poorly reviewed foreign art films. Very few people in the theater and subtitles so they have to pay attention and won't notice in the slightest that I'm slowly sliding my fingers inside your wet....opening.

Why me? Well, I have been told by more than one girlfriend that I was blessed below the waist and I am smart, witty and even more important for you, both ambidextrous and very skilled with my hands. I'm drug, disease and smoke free, can handle myself socially and I do own the perfect long coat that might go strategically over both our laps. 

I picture you in a skirt or dress that will provide, shall we say, easy access, and I'm fine with you wearing panties. I appreciate a bit of a challenge. I like the idea of building up to it as the film goes on, playing a bit of footsie, my finger tracing your palm, and a bit of light groping are all good ways to increase the heat. 

I am fine with us being anonymous or not, depending on your comfort level. We can be very clear about the guidelines as far as how far we go, and I don't expect much more than some wonderful mutual stimulation. If we hit it off, we can plan some future adventures, but there would be no obligation or expectations beyond the fantasy.

I know there are women who appreciate a great adventure as much as I do. Why don't you write and let me know about your ideas for a night at the movies. And I am more than open to a matinee!

title: Free massage! Relax and unwind for a bit
text:
I like to practice massage as a hobby but don't get to practice often enough. I'm offering free massage tonight to cool and interesting people to indulge my hobby. Sore from a couple months of new years' resolutions? Stressed from hunching over a desk at the office? Massage your tensions away!

Years ago I interned as an orthopedic surgeon, learned physical therapy and Chinese rehabilitation techniques, and put daily stresses on my body playing and coaching soccer. I now write software by day, dabbling in other creative pursuits such as winemaking and cute puppies on evenings and weekends. Massage is a hobby, not a career, and therefore not worth the time and expense of certifications or room rentals. I live alone in a one-bedroom loft in SoMa. I use a padded massage table, hot and cold buckwheat pads, using pressed coconut and other natural creams and oils to sooth your skin, penetrate muscles, and leave you loosened and reshaped. You will be warm, comfortable, and draped.

I'm 33, straight, single, and sane. I realize you may be skeptical of craigslist and this post probably appears next to someone wanting his hamster to lick your toes, but it does seem like a better way to find people interested in massage than posting a flyer on the bulletin board at Rainbow Grocery or something similar.

I enjoy learning the uniqueness of your body, its accumulated stresses, its extra sensitivities, and customize a massage as I learn. I'm able to operate outside the confinements of a spa menu or its modalities, tune-in to change, and go with the flow. Working on someone over time is best, leading to some good past projects healing runners, students hunched over desks studying, or someone who really likes the relaxing escape.

I don't like working with people who have had bad injuries that should really be under the care of a doctor or chiropractor. You should bathe regularly, be under 35 for good body recovery, have a pleasant demeanor, and be relatively in shape for good access to muscles and general body feedback. No spray-on tans or cyborg body parts. Hopefully you've hugged a puppy and helped confused tourists at some point in your life!

Long post! If you're still reading and curious you should send an email to let me know a little about you. Whereabouts do you live? Do you have a particular area of stress or tension screaming for attention? Which activities do you think might have thrown it out of whack?

Feel free to ask questions beyond what this already long posting provides. We could meet at a cafe or lounge after exchanging a few emails, learn what you enjoy in a massage, and work through some of the uncertainties meeting a stranger. Craigslist can deliver good apartments and furniture, why not a massage?

I live alone near the SoMa - Mission border about two blocks away from Muni trains. I am available tonight and possibly this weekend. Send an email to explore new possibilities and kick off body healing and relaxation.

title: 21 things you should know before dating me
text:
Get comfortable... this really *is* a list of 21 things you outta know before dating me...

Bars and clubs are not places I go to relax or meet anyone new. I drink very little and unfortunately have even less dancing talent... so if I end up in either place it's to talk with friends and or listen to the (live) music. Watching the sunset, soaking in a jacuzzi or going for a walk or are far more effective ways of relaxing than drinking in my humble opinion. 

While I admit it would make for some hot sex, if you are a Republican it's probably best that we never meet. 

 I've bullshitted my way around the fact that I can't dance my whole life. It's something I feel I've missed out on in life so despite feeling about as graceful as an elephant, I've been taking lessons starting with basic ballroom stuff with a desire to work my way towards other more contemporary styles. So if you're scared out of your mind to ever think of dancing like I was/am but are open to trying it out, or are an accomplished dancer, (not just ass grinding) it'd be great to have a partner to practice with! Note: This is not "code", I *REALLY* do want to get the steps down!

On the whole, looks rank far less than personality and intelligence. That said, most of you reading this, like me, could stand to be in some better shape... True for both of us, the closer to in shape the better. For me, I regularly play soccer, go for extended hikes and from time to time swim... if you're not already naturally slim, you MUST be a willing active participant in something athletic. Or better still, join me! :-P 

It is exceedingly difficult for me to maintain a close intimate relationship with a girl that does or ever did drugs, or smoked or is excessively religious or obese. If you hate me for this, this should be proof enough to you that anyone is not for everyone. So why spend all the extra effort to give me a piece of your mind when your anger only underscores the point??? I know, "but just about everyone has done it..." fine, I get it... I'd like to date one person who hasn't. 

Christmas = Santa Claus. Easter = Easter Bunny. Church = faking illness and watching football on TV or going to the beach. Side note about religion... it is a funny thing... it justifies lots of things, blamed very little for why crap doesn't go the way you want it to though. :-/ 

I may look at big boobs on girls, but I find smaller boobs much more attractive and have a longer shelf-life. 

I like kids. I want kids. Just not YOUR kids, right now.

I have an obscenely high credit score.

I will NEVER ask you to do anything sexual. Having to ask is pretty much like doing it myself but with half the satisfaction and twice the mess. So, with that said... some lazy weekend morning/afternoon that would be as good a time as any to give my penis some extra attention in some way that pleases us both. 

I will *never* attempt anal on you... ever! Not that I think those that are into it are bad or anything... I'm all for the kinky... just not the wiping of shit off my dick. 

If you love your dog/cat/animal, fine... but being "in love" with it is just creepy and kind of gross. I always thought of myself as someone that liked animals quite a bit until I dated someone that used their poor little dog as a child/barbi doll surrogate! 

I look younger than I am. Some day it will catch up to me, but for now... at the risk of a full blown rant, it*sucks*!!! It's different when you're a girl and look younger, and no, we're not talking that I look 12 or anything weird like that... but my biggest gripe is that "age appropriate" women (in the eyes of most of society) almost without fail seem to develop a "thing" about how "old" they look in relation to how old I look. Despite anything I say or do, it first chafes and then grinds on the insecurities of a lot of women and then it's just a downward spiral soon after that... :-/ As for younger women that *look* age appropriate (in the eyes of most of society) it also sucks forever being in a perpetual "trying-to-find-myself-have-daddy-issues" parade. Sure, age is just a number, but it's been my experience so far that younger women tend to be generally unaware/unappreciative and perhaps are just unequipped to reciprocate simple care, affection and intimacy beyond just sex. Hey, sex is great... but... despite what your high school/college boyfriend convinced you was the case... it really isn't the only thing a guy is looking for! 

Yes, there are times I am a little bit cocky and sometimes it borders on being a little arrogant. Having the ability to tactfully put me in check as needed is appreciated!!! 

Two truths one lie... guess what's the lie and you could win one of several fabulous prizes!!! 1) I'm a certified lifeguard 2) Big fan of hiphop, jazz and big band music 3) I won a trophy for my computer programming prowess 

There's no such thing as a free lunch... if I cook for you, don't tell me it's "good" I'm forever trying out new stuff and from what people that have tried what I make have said so far, I'm getting quite good at it. What'd be really useful is for you to give me a little feedback about why it's good, or why it's bad. You offering to help clean up is nice, but not required.

The term "racial" didn't mean anything to me until after I was 14 year old. Where and how I was raised "race" issues never came up because everyone was mixed up with everything else. I don't understand people that are hung up on racial bullshit. Fact, if you're an asshole, you're an asshole no matter what color you are! 

Sometimes I snore, not so often though.

I studied the German language in high school and the Japanese language in college. "Why Japanese?" is the single most often question I'm asked after people find this out. The answer comes in four parts: 1) I can't deny the food is healthy and great! 2) The lack a strong religion component to the culture that gets in the way of anything I want to eat or how or when I have sex. 3) The vast majority of the women are intelligent, multilingual and have never even seen drugs let alone took them and rarely smoke. All of these things I tend to find extremely attractive in a potential girlfriend! Ah yes, let's not forget number 4) No one expects a doofis like me to be able to speak Japanese which was never the case whenever I spoke German. "Asian fetish" you are thinking? Nah, I really don't care... see #17 for further guidance. :-)

In high school, I received as many "A"s as "F"s... graduated with a C average... somehow.

I dream of a day where all feminine hygiene products, pregnancy testing kits, toilet paper and erectile dysfunction advertisements are no more! That said, when it comes to any of these things, I would have no qualms about picking them up for you should the need occur. 



BONUS
 Congrats on getting all the way through this... So you read my posting and think I could be an interesting guy to meet up with... GREAT! To help separate the real people from the copious amounts computer generated spam, and people that are, "just bored" don't just "one line" me... Tell me a little bit about yourself! If you don't know what to say, please answer this one question: What was the last thing you did that made you smile? For those of you that respond with something interesting and insightful you can expect a quick reply... For those that also include a picture that accurately depicts them you can expect an even faster reply... or not! It'll all depend on what you say, and what if anything you send with it. Unfortunately for us all Love is a fickle Mistress like that. ;-/

title: Somewhat newly back in SF
text:
Let's get this out of the way first: I'm married and polyamorous.

OK, Now that I've weeded out all those adverse to polyamory:

I've lived in San Francisco since I was 12, but I've spent the last 20 years living in DC, Detroit (suburbs), and Reno (14 years!). San Francisco has always remained my home and I'm very happy to finally be back. I moved to Potrero Hill about year ago, but with so long an absence I don't really have any old friends remaining here. 

I'm looking to explore the city and the quirky things it has to offer. The food is one of my favorite things about SF, but I also love the fact that there's so much to do in the surrounding area. I've always loved the beach, the Marin Headlands, Harbin :( , and the like. 

I'm plugged into the national sex positive community, but I haven't done a great job of networking in SF (I'm working on that this month). I'm just starting to get comfortable with my new life here and settle back in. I'd love to meet someone who's poly-oriented, non-monogamous, sex positive, and open-minded. I'm not really kinky, but I'm happy to explore that side of me for the right person. 

I'm 47, but youthful (don't we all say that?) and seriously don't look my age. If I didn't have some gray hair, you'd never guess I was 46. I prefer someone youthful like me, but age appropriate; however, age isn't a big factor in who I'm willing to date. 

I'm easy-going, non-judgmental, optimistic, and honestly drama-free. My wife and I have been non-monogamous since 2008 and fully poly since 2012. We love each other greatly and have an awesome marriage. Despite that, I'm emotionally available and have the freedom to pursue a second relationship. I don't have to get permission to spend time with others, and there's no jealousy or ownership in my marriage. 

This ad lists a lot about me, but that's because I don't like to limit my options. I love meeting women who are very different, and I don't seek out particular qualities other than honestly, emotional maturity, and respect. However, the closer you live to SF the better. 

If I sound like someone you'd like to get to know, please drop me a note and I'll send you a picture. I'm a good looking guy and do my best to stay in decent shape.

title: What Happens when you're 30(ish) and Still Single
text:
Once you are in your 30's the whole dating scene changes. Lemme tell you, it sucks the big one.

For Men: The women you meet will be:

A- Sluts (Spent their 20's jumping so fast from guy to guy looking for the love daddy never showed them.)
B- The Jaded Chick (either has never found love before and doesn't believe in it, or was in a long-term relationship that ended badly. Has potential if you have patience)
C- The Gold-digger (the first thing she will ask is "So, what do you do for a living?")
D- The Desperate Damsel (looking to get married, will put the relationship into hyper drive and overlook reality for the ring).
E- The Divorcee with kids (Tired needs help, will settle. If you want an instant family, she's probably going to take very good care of you.)
F- The Married Woman (husband cheated, she's getting her revenge. Expect animal sex.)
G- The Career Frenzy (was trying to prove something to her family and found herself busier than she could possibly handle, can be a good find if she has learned good work/life balance.)
H- The Uptight (nobody will ever be perfect for her)
I- The Drama Junkie (if you are relaxed and normal, she will be 'bored' and missing the drama she had in the past)

For Women: The men who ask you out will be:
A- Married (all those guys who married in their early-mid 20's have discovered that their sweet, loving wife is a shrew who wouldn't blow them after they said their vows).
B- Over 40 (for some reason, as soon as you hit the magic 3-0 all the old farts seem to think you should be grateful for their attention.)
C- Playboys (Had fun while he was good looking and young. Find themselves stuck home alone while their "posse" has married off)
D- The Divorced Man with kids (run...looking for a mom, housekeeper, cook, laundress etc. Afraid of sex because they have learned the hard way what a pain it is to have kids).
E-The Younger Man (These guys love the idea of dating an older chick, will learn all they can from ya then go find an 18 yr old to show off their new skills).
F- The Career guy (found himself on the fast track, realized that work sucks, can be a good find if he has learned that his personal life should be a priority.)
G- The Idealist (sincerely believes that "just have not found the right person yet", but breaks up for reason like "she couldn't cook", "he didn't challenge me enough"...bottom line: nobody had a chance.

All in all, a pretty sad scene for both sexes. I've discovered that Saturday night at home can be a whole lotta fun. Ok, maybe not fun, but better than the dating jungle. (Oh, if I had to categorize myself, I'd be a Career guy. At this point, I wish I was a Playboy ;) Aw shit, too late to lose the morals. Hope you have better luck than me.

Looking to meet someone fun, cute and normal.

My job can be pretty demanding and I'm looking for some time to forget about the day to day. I've been married since 1992 and do care about my wife, but we've also been physically detached for the last few years. My intention is to satisfy that part of my life that is currently missing and in turn pleasure you however you'd like me to. I hope this doesn't turn you off but understand if it does. So if you're interested or just curious....contact me.

title: Married But Desire More?
text:
Hello All,

Thanks for taking the time to read my ad amongst so many that are out there. Chances are if, you're like me and odds that you are considering you're reading this, you are either married or attached and there's something missing in your marriage. What is missing is probably passion, romance and intimacy. If that's correct, then we already have something in common. 

I've been with the same woman for 15 years, married for 12 and have one child with her. My child means everything to me and if you have any children, I'm sure you can understand that. 

I have no intention of changing my current relationship because of several reasons and I am not looking to change anyone else's relationship either. What I'm hoping to find is someone who like me, has a void in their personal life and they would like to fill that void. A chance to experience what it is like to get to know someone and feel desire and passion again.

If you're interested and would like to see if we're compatible, feel free to send me and email. 

Hope to hear from you soon!

title: Can YOU Relate?
text:
I wonder how many others out there might be in a similar situation I'm about to describe? Perhaps you're dating someone or perhaps you're married. You may even have a home and children. Overall things are pretty good but for some reason the romance and passion in your relationship have seemed to have slipped away. You may or may not know why, but either way you find yourself wanting to feel desired once again. What do you do? You've brought it to their attention, yet nothing seems to improve or if it does, it's just for a short period of time.

Let's go a little farther. As some or many would tell you, just leave. However, that isn't as simple as they make it out to be. With a home, or children things are much more dynamic. So what to do then?

If that sounds familiar we already have something in common. I am married and have been for ten years now. We have one child together. I work full time and have a home. The passion in our relationship has slowly dwindled over time. It has gotten to a point where I've stopped being romantic or attempting to be physical with her because of constantly being rejected. It's hard to keep hearing No, because (fill in the excuse).

As I mentioned above, leaving is not an option for me. Some reading this might think otherwise and I respect your opinion. There is just part of me that feels empty for a lack of a better term and I'd rather not have it be that way.

What I'm looking for is someone who might be in a similar type of situation as I am in. I have no intention of taking you away from your partner/spouse. My hope is that the two of us might be able to fulfill a void we both have.

If I've piqued your interest or maybe you'd just like to exchange emails, feel free to write. I'd enjoy hearing from you no matter what you may be looking for.

title: Missing Something In Your Relationshp??
text:
Yes, me too! 

First, thank you for taking the time to read my ad, especially with how many are out there. Let me see if I can get close to describing your current relationship. You are either married or attached. For whatever particular reason or perhaps even a variety of reasons leaving the relationship you're currently in is not just an option. I'm sure many friends and acquaintances have told you just to leave, but again, it's just not that simple. For the most part it is a good relationship, but the intimacy is lacking or non-existent, leaving you feeling unfulfilled. Alas, which is why you are here.

One day, up in the frozen north a polar bear and his son were out for a stroll. Daddy bear sat on a lump of ice to admire the view and sent his son off to play. Two minutes later Junior came back to dad and says, "Can I ask you a question dad?"

"Sure, son what is it?"

"Am I a real polar bear, Dad?" asks Junior.

Dad smiles and says, "Of course you are, son. Now go and play."

So off Junior goes again throws some snowballs at the seals but soon he's back.

"Hey Dad, are you sure I am a real polar bear? Is there not a wee bit of brown bear or black bear in me?"

Dad smiles again and says, "Look son you've got big hairy black feet, a white coat, and a black shiny nose...of course you're a polar bear....now go back and play."

Once again Junior runs off...slides down the ice....chases a couple of seagulls...after ten minutes of fun

he returns with a puzzled look on his face.....

"Look son...I'm a polar bear, your mums a polar bear, your granny and grandpa were polar bears...why

are you asking all these questions?"

title: DATE Movie
text:
I wonder if the magic spark can ever come back into my life? I often think about it........from time to time. Perhaps you might be thinking the same thing. 
Being a Single Latin Dad, I have to admit, I have been truly in love in my lifetime and there is nothing like it. Simply nothing. six five owe eight one four two six one two 
When a single parent goes year after year and doesn't somehow, someway stumble across someone , it feels like time is slipping away. 
My life is ok work, gym , eats , some sleep.. hugs, of course is missing however, if one really wants and needs that, it can be had...
Its funny but, it is finding that one person that when I look at her, words are hard to come out of my mouth. When I sit next to her, there is no need for words. Simply look into her eyes and two hearts feel it without one single word. Is it over for me? 
Is it even possible to find, or rediscover, and feel love again .
Is touching her going to be just as incredible as it once was in my life? 
Will my heart go nuts with a simple kiss? 
Will she have that effect on me?............Desire. 

How do we find that one? I Love dating.. When we were younger, it was SO easy to meet then let things all fall into place. Now, we put up all sorts of obstacles. 

My dream is to one day meet a female at a coffee shop and I find the courage to say, "excuse me, you are really pretty and I am finding it hard not to say anything". Would she smile, would she tell me where to go or would she simply look at me as if I was a ok? 
Do we go to a bar and flirt? Do we go to a restaurant and chat? Do we post something online? Do we try Internet dating? Who the heck knows? 
Me? I am a happy, well grounded, and content Dad. It would seem that I don't really need anything in my life. BUT, there is always that 'time', when I am alone that I think to myself, "could it be different'? I am stable, secure and most weeks, there are a couple of days I get lonely and find myself reading through these posts and wonder what it would be like to have someone come over for a drink and get to know each other. I think about it each week and do nothing about it. Today 2016 I am writing my thoughts on here. Obviously, there is a gap in my life. I have no clue what to do or how to do it........ I mean, filling that gap. 
What kind of Female do I truly adore? Being honest, that is easy for me to share: I love my female to be........... 
Stunning in my eyes both inside her heart and outside.... 
Extremely kind hearted, spiritual, and LOVES to feel true love........ 
Incredible at listening and communicating with everyone she comes into contact with.....
She loves and adores her family and ALWAYS puts them first..... 
She is well educated and a hard worker who sets goals and achieves them... 
Her integrity is through the roof and her friends/peers respect her..... 
She is down to earth, self-confident and can hold her own in any given situation.... 
as hers do
someway, bring her into my life, slowly, gently, most beautifully and most understandingly. 
True love. Is it still out there for those of us who are single ? 
If you took the time to read this dreary yet emotional outpouring, responses are not only welcome, they are desired.
I am ready to open up a part of my world that I closed off after my time in the USMC . Why did I do that? I am not sure . A relationship at times doesn't seem possible BUT, if two people can start off with a deep desire to see each other once or even twice a week, that alone is so much better than not at all or sitting at home thinking about it. 
Just thoughts and desires. I have often thought about using a dating site but have not done that. If you have done that and had success, please let me know which ones to try. I would like to be a great addition to someone's life. Especially if you are close to your parents. My family lives in another State and sometimes, that makes things pretty hard not being around them. 
Thank you for reading. I feel pretty nice getting my feelings out.As a Military Guy in The Marine Corps we are thought not to talk about stuff like this but I feel free now and I am to be able to write this , Although we may never meet, there is a tiny chance, we will. If you answered 'yes, that's me', to my little wish list, then we really should chat here. 
I am spiritual, spontaneous, ambitious yet non-materialistic, and truly try to seriously achieve all my goals. I am attractive, slender, caring, passionate, well educated and I have traveled a lot both here and overseas. I feel I have lots to offer the right female. So, to wrap this long thing up, what am I sure about? 
I hope one day to be wrapped up in someone's arms that I don't want to be without. When we ask ourselves one question, we get all the answers we need. That question is simple: Imagine my life with her in it. Now imagine my life without her in it. Which? 
Thank you kindly for reading. I hope I touched one heart that is in the same place as mine.
I leave you with one last thought......One heart. With so many people in this entire world, why, oh why is it SO hard to find our ONE HEART?
I don't want to give up on believing I can find you and you, me. 
YESTERDAY IS HISTORY , TOMORROW A MYSTERY, AND TODAY A GIFT. Adam R. A Romantic Latin adam95008atyahoodotcom

title: A very particular, special type of fantasy...
text:
Can two people meet each other based on a shared fantasy, and build something that grows into a mutually fulfilling, loving relationship? I'd like to think so.. 

It's a fantasy based around two people who have great love and respect for each other. Two people who have known each other for a long, long time, but perhaps only more recently started having more romantic feelings for each other. They each know that they shouldn't in any sane world express these feelings to each other, and so they hold back. Neither wants to hurt the other, nor risk ruining their wonderful relationship in the event they've misjudged the other's feelings. 

But what if? 

How magical could it be, if they shared each other's affections and finally had the chance to truly open their hearts and souls to each other? How glorious and ultimately fulfilling could it be, if they broke through their nervous barriers and finally had the chance to be as one? Ohhhh god, just the thought of it! 

It would have to be a closely guarded secret, of course.. Known only to the two of you. Nobody else would understand or accept it. Quite the contrary, in fact. But that almost adds to the desire - knowing that you shouldn't, knowing that it would be wrong, according to most. A little rebellion now and then.. You know?

I am, of course, talking about a mother and her son.. The ultimate taboo, the ultimate no-no. But according to who? Everyone else, who's personal affairs and relationships are no more your business than yours are theirs? 

It is not, of course, a relationship you jump into without careful consideration. Part of sharing in these most intimate of feelings is the responsibility you both have to each other to make sure that this is in fact what you both really want. There are simple practicalities to consider as well, even beyond the myriad emotions involved. The traditional mother-son relationship would never be the same again. Children, of course, could never be a factor, but that's something you're both quite ok with anyway. But in the end, in this fantasy, you are both confident in your hearts that it is indeed what you want. You both love each other with all your hearts, and you eagerly await the day that you finally get to share all that love with each other...


This is a fantasy that I've had for a long time, and I've not yet met the right woman to fully share it with and explore where it could go. There are a lot of men out there with mom fantasies, and I can only speak for myself, but mine isn't based solely on the pure animal lust of doing something you shouldn't. My fantasy is based around two other-worldly passionate people, and the idea that a mother and son's love for each other is so powerful, and their mutual attraction so great, that they're willing to go against accepted societal barriers, because they know how truly magical it can be. That's how strong their connection is. 

In this fantasy, there's no-one else involved. No-one cheated on, nor betrayed. I'd like for life to imitate that as well. 

As for me, I am a white man in my early thirties. I'm tall, with short dark brown hair and brown eyes. I've been told that I am handsome and manly, but all things appearance are in the eye of the beholder, right? I've also been told by numerous people over the years that I'm an old soul. Perhaps that explains my interest in finding someone older than myself..

I only ask of you that you be your natural self. I'm always attracted to a woman because of who she is and her own natural beauty, not because of fancy clothes or makeup that simply hides the natural beauty underneath. This whole fantasy is based around love and adoration that comes from within anyway..

So, if you've come this far, and want to come a little farther, contact me. Perhaps a chat over coffee? Maybe lunch? A casual, no expectations way to explore whether or not there's a connection, and hopefully mutual attraction. Nothing ventured, nothing gained?

If you share this fantasy, but maybe you're nervous about opening up to anyone else about it(like I have been), consider.. I share it too, so if there's anyone to share it with who won't judge you for it, it's me. 

Tell me a little about yourself. However much or little you feel comfortable sharing. Ask me anything you like. I'm eager to connect with someone as passionate as I am..

Hope to hear from you...

Are you thrilled by subtly showing yourself off in public?

I am referring to completely "acceptable" appearances, yet revealing enough that, for those with eyes and a taste for such things, quite a lot can be seen.

Nothing that would alert the morality police, or worse, of course.

If you occasionally thrill from being observed, or perhaps have long fantasized about doing such things, please read on.

I'm a sane, sophisticated man in my 50's. Tall, healthy. I adore a woman who "owns" this sort of activity.
I'm seeking a friend for whom I can offer support.

I also can cover you such that, should anyone be too forward in approaching you, I can step in and negate unwanted interaction.

If this piques your interest please get in touch. On the surface I suppose it's a bit pervy but the reality is, I'm totally sane and together and genuinely want the interaction to be on this level. It's not a scam to get in yer pants. Seriously.

title: Great Guy For Female Companionship
text:
Hello,

I was seeing someone and now that it has been over for some time, I decided to see if anyone is out there looking for a new friend. We broke up soon after I was looking for advice from a friend over coffee. It was broached that the relationship was unhealthy and toxic. I was in denial thinking that all relationships have their trials but in the midst of an outbreak of insanity, the boulder of reality fell on me. I had to do what is best for both of us and not try to counter her threat to leave me. I'm not perfect and am equally at fault but it was like waking up in Hell over and over again seeing the torturous, looping eternity that awaited if I didn't leave. I've regrouped now and objectively feel I am not completely without merit.

Now I'm here looking for a companion, friend, partner in crime and someone who wants to keep an open mind about the future. Hard knocks taught me it's more beneficial to all involved to take it slow. There's much ado about nothing or much to do about everything is my mantra now. What say we have fun checking out the local scene and what it has to offer. To let you know, I have been married and maybe you have to so that definitely plays into what happens. This post is not a clever disguise for a one night stand so please don't hit the back button and click on the ad by the guy with a solo Kodak moment of his "junk". If you want to see Tiki statues or shrunken heads wouldn't you go to Wikipedia and not here?

Who am I? I'm different than most males vis a vis. I'm a little geeky, nerdy and my mind is like a popcorn popper with ideas for us to do. I am a professional Caucasian male, 6 foot, cute, exercises often but not a gym rat. I like to do what is interesting, fun, creative, thought provoking and leads to good conversation and laughs. I am an active listener and won't leave you bored to death talking about myself, my woes and leave you wondering if you yelled fire and ran out of the building would I get it. I like to stay current on the world around me, believe everyone has something to teach and something to learn, like to read, eat and go where there are people for music et al or stay home. For habits, I don't smoke and I do not over indulgence in alcohol if at all. I do not have tattoos and no piercings of any kind on any part of my body.

Who are you? You are near my age physically or mentally, intelligent, engaging in thought and word, has a sense of humor, attractive, exercises (no cigs), potentially takes vitamins ( I hate to so one of has to) and likes to go out or stay home. I don't mind a little extra padding but more than that I will not be interested - sorry, it's me, not you. Please have inner beauty but have some on the outside, too. Race, well, Asian (never dated), Caucasian or European ethnicity.

Type February in the subject and recent photos expedite reciprocation in kind. Prom photos will make me laugh.

Let's see if this sticks. 
CM

Whether you read these for a good laugh or you're unconventional enough to try to meet someone on here I appreciate you reading.

If you dig the ad and you think I might be up your alley, say hi.

Also tell me about yourself, whatever that question means to you.

Thanks

title: My Girlfriend Application and Test
text:
First, a little about me. I'm a smart, fun, easy going, cute, educated guy who has a great career and a wonderful family/friends. I'm tired of wasting my time, so I have formulated some mandatory criteria in part A and part B is based on points.

Part A

1) You must be born female. Sorry, no trannies, this is San Francisco!
2) You must own something to wear to a formal reception.
3) You must not own or ever wear birkenstocks or crocs footwear.
4) All your parts need to be in good working order, further testing will need to be conducted of course.
5) I can't accept a regular drug user, despite SF culture.
6) You must own at least two dresses. You need to look presentable standing next to me.
7) Your height must be proportional to your weight using the standard AMA guidelines.
8) You have to have lived in the US for at least two consecutive years.
9) You must have a photo which was taken in the last 3 months.
10) You should be fluent with English. Sorry, I'm not a part-time ESL teacher.

If you meet all of the requirements above then you may continue, if not, then you are now dismissed but thank you for applying to be my girfriend.

Now: give yourself two points for each of the following criteria you meet

Part B

1) You have (or are working on) a degree.
2) You own a car and have a valid driver's license. Suspended for DUIs: minus 10 points.
3) You've never worn Ed Hardy, Affliction or any other Christian Audigier affiliated brand.
4) You play (or are interested in) at least one sport.
5) You have skills in bed. Not because you think you do, because your past experiences have told you.
6) You are not a born again Christian or any other kind of religious fanatic.
7) You have been to at least one country outside of North America. 
8) You like stepping out of your bubble and trying new things. 
9) You can make it through an adventurous event without complaining (we don't have to tell your friends).
10) You have a great sense of humour. Are people laughing with you, or at you?
11) You can dress-up for a good date without any help or advice from me. "I don't know what to wear, what do you want me to wear" isn't an answer.
12) You work out and enjoy being physically active. I hit the gym at least three times a week, you should too.
13) You have a job that requires more than a high school diploma.
14) You have a 5 year goal for yourself.
15) You aren't afraid of being yourself, even if you have a dorky side.
16) You're competitive, and I don't mean you like to battle it out with your WoW buddies on the weekends.

If you have a score of 20+ then please contact me immediately. If you scored between 10-20 pts, you can still trying contacting me, but I don't have a lot of hope. If you did not score high enough, then please do not contact me, but if at some time in the future you are able to improve yourself and meet the minimum requirements, then you may re-apply.

I thank you in advance for your application, however, only successful candidates will receive a response.

text:

I read a lot, belong to the Asian Art Museum, and enjoy book talks, live jazz, snuggling on the couch and walking in the rain. I'm both lighthearted and intricate and try to laugh at silly things, light candles, cook healthy food, search for meaning, watch independent films, fly kites, listen, grow, learn, share and be challenged...

Basically, I'd love to find someone attractive, healthy, honest, natural, creative, and kind to get together with for a cup of tea. No pressure or expectations -- just fun connection, witty banter, spiritual and/or intellectual exploration, and a warm cup to sooth the senses...

Interested? Drop me a note!

title: Ok I Give Up - trying to meet a "nice" girl
text: OK - I have been trying to meet a "nice" girl for quite a while now (two months), using both traditional methods (set-ups through friends, the bar scene, work, etc.) and non-traditional (i.e., internet dating), and have had abysmal results. By "nice", I don't mean a bible-thumping, republican, up-tight putz who could make a diamond out of a lump of coal. I mean a girl who is capable of having a decent conversation that doesn't center around her shoe collection; who is aware of the world around her; who is respectful of people and animals; who doesn't clip her fingernails on the train; who puts a smile on my face; who parties like a rock star when she has the time. Someone with a brain, a sense of humor and a job. I'm cute, funny, smart, successful, sweet, caring, interesting etc and have a life. Email me if you exist.

title: Dating is just awkward, no matter where you meet the person
text:
I apologize to you if I don't seem real eager to jump into a forced awkward intimate situation that people like to call dating. I don't like the feeling. You're sitting there, you're wondering do I have food on my face, am I eating, am I talking too much, are they talking enough, am I interested I'm not really interested, should I play like I'm interested but I'm not that interested but I think she might be interested but do I want to be interested but now she's not interested? So all of the sudden I'm getting, I'm starting to get interested... And when am I supposed to kiss her? Do I have to wait for the door cause then it's awkward, it's like well goodnight. Do you do like that a$$-out hug? Where you like, you hug each other like this and your ass sticks out cause you're trying not to get too close or do you just go right in and kiss them on the lips or don't kiss them at all? It's very difficult trying to read the situation. And all the while you're just really wondering are we gonna get hopped up enough to make some bad decisions?"

This pretty much sums it up. Dating is just awkward, no matter where you meet the person. So, I figured, why not? And, after careful review, I have come to this conclusion that this site is like the bars, but with no long lines, no cheap drinks, and easier to cut to the chase.

It would be nice to find a buddy to explore the area again. :) I love learning, asking questions, and figuring out how things work. I also love to have fun with my friends, family, and enjoy all the wonderful things life has to offer.

I can be sarcastic, maybe to a point where people may think I'm serious, but I'm not. I am serious at times when I need to be. I think life is too short not to: laugh at the things we can't control, enjoy what we have, and really love the ones that are in it with us. I love sports, especially snowboarding. I love trying to play new sports ("try" is the key word). I'm about to start taking golf lessons and tennis lessons. Should be fun(ny).

About you... Normal, smart,funny, (I know, we all think we're that). Feel free to: Know how to spell, not be creepy (If you're not sure you are creepy, go ahead and ask a friend. If you don't have anyone to ask, that may be a sign). Really, though, personality is everything. Sense of humor is a must. Like everyone, looking for a best friend and partner etc.

title: What A Woman Needs
text:
In my travels, I've noticed that women say that they want certain things. They want a man who is somewhat handsome, funny, educated, gainfully employed, and generally fun to be around. When they get it, they often find that it's not really what they want and the poor sap is sent to the friend zone. Many men throw up their hands and exclaim that women don't really know what they want. 

I believe that most people are confusing issues. What women want is different than what they need. Forget what the feminists and the talking heads in the media and academia have to say about the subject. I believe that most of the issues can be summarized as what women must have: 

Passion: Women are sexual creatures, just like men. They require an exciting and uninhibited sex life. They require it to be fresh so that it doesn't become the same old routine over and over. It seems that many men do not take the time to learn the skills to truly satisfy their lovers. When not fulfilled, women will seek new partners to fulfill this need without feeling guilt, whether they are married or not. 

Romance: Romance is not dead or the unrealistic expectations of an idealist. Women love the idea of forming a deep emotional bond with a challenging man. Masculine and feminine elements fuse together and balance each other. These elements are not supposed to be at odds with each other or engaged in a "battle of the sexes". 

Fantasy: Women select different men for different reasons at different times in their lives. Fantasies, sexual or otherwise change over the course of a lifetime. From good little girl to unrestrained naughty girl and back to the little girl who does what she wants to do. It is important for men to understand this general process, and even indulge in such fantasies from time to time. 

Dichotomy: During the day, a woman is an educated career person with goals. But at night, she expresses her sexuality like a slut (Without actually being a slut. Big difference). Innocent by day, naughty by night. In control of her life by day, and submissive to her man at night. It is important to recognize the boundaries as the night time attitude is usually confined to the bedroom with the highest degree of privacy. 

Respect: I believe that this one goes without saying. A woman must be respected by her man and respect him in turn. Without respect, there is no basic foundation for a healthy relationship. With respect, a woman is comfortable and able to become all the things that she wants to be, sexual or otherwise. 

Emotions: A woman needs to be in touch with her emotions. She needs a man who understands this and can bring out her emotions. Even those that she didn't know she had. 

Wouldn't it be nice if there were men out there that understood these fundamental concepts? Or better yet, willing and able to put them into practice with the right woman?

title: RE: Do men 'date' anymore? (concord / pleasant hill / martinez)
text:
You posted this post and asked a question, I wanted to respond but got a "mailer demon" response. I'm hoping you read my response and decide to comment on it one way or another. I am not seeking out responses from other woman but if someone has an opinion on my response feel welcome to include your experience. Perhaps I should include her post and then add my response.

Initial Post:

My Response:

I can answer your question based on my recent limited experience, I remember dating as you have just described and it's really the way I would prefer it. Today's social media and on line dating process lacks the intimate element, I'm not speaking of the physical, I'm talking about sitting across the table from someone, listening to their words and taking in all of their facial expressions and pitch of their voice as you learn about one another.

Taking in all of their varied expressions and nuances that make up their personality traits and piercing into their eye's which have their own story to tell. No one seems to want to take the time to really and truly get to know each other. I believe that is why there are so many fly by night relationships these days. 

No one wants to put in the work it might take to have a lasting and loving relationship, the minute one little thing sways in the wrong direction everyone just wants to "abandon ship".

Lastly and please don't take this wrong, it seems that many woman seem to have a notion that if you do not agree with them on whatever subject is being discussed, that you are somehow putting them down or somehow telling them how they should think. 

Just because two people have a different opinion on a particular subject, why can't that just be what it is and why does it have to be taken as a personal affront. I have recently gotten back into dating after a number of years being single and I'm already questioning this whole new way of doing things.

I'm about ready to just abandon this process and let fate take it's course and wait for a happenstance meeting by chance. If that is at the grocery store, book store, in line at the movie theater or museum and just happen to begin small talk with a total stranger. 

Something has to be easier than typed words on a screen that hides the human in us. I'm not sure if much of this makes any sense to you and I apologize if anything I said, offended you in any way.

Thank you for your post, Manny.

Physically, I'm white, 5'10" tall with dark hair, a little rugged, and a little chubby but not huge. I'm aggressively losing weight and getting in shape, but I still have a little bit to go. title: Married But Desire More?
text:
Hello All,

Thanks for taking the time to read my ad amongst so many that are out there. Chances are if, you're like me and odds that you are considering you're reading this, you are either married or attached and there's something missing in your marriage. What is missing is probably passion, romance and intimacy. If that's correct, then we already have something in common. 

I've been with the same woman for 15 years, married for 12 and have one child with her. My child means everything to me and if you have any children, I'm sure you can understand that. 

I have no intention of changing my current relationship because of several reasons and I am not looking to change anyone else's relationship either. What I'm hoping to find is someone who like me, has a void in their personal life and they would like to fill that void. A chance to experience what it is like to get to know someone and feel desire and passion again.

If you're interested and would like to see if we're compatible, feel free to send me and email. 

Hope to hear from you soon!

title: Fantasizing About an Affair?
text:
Let me see if I can describe your situation and why you are here. Perhaps you're married or in a serious relationship and for a variety of reasons, the closeness both emotionally and physically you once had is now gone. You might have even had several talks, complained, seen a counselor but nothing seems to help long term. To make things even more complicated, there may be financial issues or children involved preventing you from trying to start over. 

If any of that sounds familiar, you're not alone! 

More importantly, we are in a similar situation and might be looking for the same things. I am a 39 year old married white male. Educated, work for a living and enjoy living life. I am longing to find someone to re-kindle those feelings and excitement that once existed in our lives. I am not looking to steal someone away from their spouse or ruin their home life at all. I completely understand and respect boundaries and hopefully you do as well. 

If this sounds like something you've been longing for, feel free to write!

title: Missing Something In Your Relationshp??
text:
Yes, me too! 

First, thank you for taking the time to read my ad, especially with how many are out there. Let me see if I can get close to describing your current relationship. You are either married or attached. For whatever particular reason or perhaps even a variety of reasons leaving the relationship you're currently in is not just an option. I'm sure many friends and acquaintances have told you just to leave, but again, it's just not that simple. For the most part it is a good relationship, but the intimacy is lacking or non-existent, leaving you feeling unfulfilled. Alas, which is why you are here.

Perhaps you wish somehow you could stay in your current relationship, yet fill that void that currently exists? How close am I getting so far? If I'm close, we are in the same boat.....

I've been married for over 10 years and have one beautiful daughter that I simply could not bear to be without. For the most part my relationship is pretty good, minus the non-existent sex life. For a multitude of reasons, I cannot nor will not leave the relationship I'm in. Yet at the same time, I find myself longing to be physically desired by someone once again. 

If it sounds like we have something in common, feel free to write, I'd enjoy hearing from you no matter where it leads.

title: Can YOU Relate?
text:
I wonder how many others out there might be in a similar situation I'm about to describe? Perhaps you're dating someone or perhaps you're married. You may even have a home and children. Overall things are pretty good but for some reason the romance and passion in your relationship have seemed to have slipped away. You may or may not know why, but either way you find yourself wanting to feel desired once again. What do you do? You've brought it to their attention, yet nothing seems to improve or if it does, it's just for a short period of time.

Let's go a little farther. As some or many would tell you, just leave. However, that isn't as simple as they make it out to be. With a home, or children things are much more dynamic. So what to do then?

If that sounds familiar we already have something in common. I am married and have been for ten years now. We have one child together. I work full time and have a home. The passion in our relationship has slowly dwindled over time. It has gotten to a point where I've stopped being romantic or attempting to be physical with her because of constantly being rejected. It's hard to keep hearing No, because (fill in the excuse).

As I mentioned above, leaving is not an option for me. Some reading this might think otherwise and I respect your opinion. There is just part of me that feels empty for a lack of a better term and I'd rather not have it be that way.

What I'm looking for is someone who might be in a similar type of situation as I am in. I have no intention of taking you away from your partner/spouse. My hope is that the two of us might be able to fulfill a void we both have.

If I've piqued your interest or maybe you'd just like to exchange emails, feel free to write. I'd enjoy hearing from you no matter what you may be looking for.

title: Honest intentions.
text:
I hope you can appreciate clear, respectful communication, and a pretty thoughtful offering from my post. It can be so hard to feel out people in cyberspace. Hopefully you can feel a certain resonance with my words. I'm a humble (and non-creepy!) man. 

So this is where I describe myself and highlight all the best parts of myself to someone who doesn't know me hoping they don't get distracted from having to read too much right? Well, I recently hit that magic 30, which came with much reflection and a new sort of awe. I've witnessed a lot of beauty, and just as much hardship in my life. I truly look for the single grain of beauty that might live in any person, or situation. 

It's a gift-curse: sometimes it seems like that sort of dedication to finding the beauty in anything attracts leeches and mixed blessings, as opposed to the obvious beauties that anyone can recognize. I'm a good friend, always willing to lend a hand or ear. I'm a thoughtful listener, with a propensity for truth telling. No one has time for bull, or lies, or half-truths, or games. 

I've been dealt a hand of liars throughout my years, which makes it easier to spot them I guess. But I revel in the shiny types. Truth is so very sexy, particularly hard truths. Some of my truths might be hard to manage, better you evaluate now then become interested and have them slowly released. 

Even so, I miss being lively and having that special girl in my arms that I trust and adore! I miss being a tangle of sweaty bodies and gentle exploration. I want a connection, understanding, and compassion for one another before the quaking closeness. 

I feel like the scenario I'm proposing could be a good fit. Traditional dating doesn't feel right, it's so hit or miss, and these are the precious last days of my youth that I don't want to miss out on. 

If we aren't looking for the same things, I would feel guilty if I were taking time away from you to traditionally date and vice versa. I want a solid connection, some passion and hot moments without the pressure of blending a relationship into our already functioning schedule, and an exchange that values the time we share (this would be a financial arrangement agreement) would be ideal.

Please know that I can understand if you haven't done something like this before, and that true connection is quite important to me. This to me seems like it could be a win all around. If this is something you've been desiring than please elaborate on your sexiness and beauty. I would hope you get a lot of attention from men, but I know your true beauty is in person- you can't fake that. 

I love a petite or tall girl, fit, blonde, brunette, green/blue eyes, with or without a fair share of tattoos. I would hope you come off as very well-kept, even classy. Maybe a librarian/teacher or wild woman, and in your heart maybe lives a bit of both. In any case, I hope you find a lovely companion or whatever drew you to these various posts. It is so hard to have passion to share and not have the right person to share it with. Humans really do need other humans to love and touch.

title: Nerdy guy seeking nerdy gal!
text:
I'm a nerdy guy in a few different ways. I like my videogames (RPG's being one of my favorite genres). I like my anime (Hellsing Ultimate, Naruto Shippuden, Full Metal Alchemist, Hajime No Ippo, Summer Wars, Chobits, the list goes on). I also geek out about cars sometimes, I love working on my car. I like to build random things with my Arduino (I'm working on a 16x16 multiplexed LED array right now). I also enjoy tabletop games be it classics like Risk or Monopoly. newer ones like Pandemic or Dead of Winter. I have even dabbled in a bit of D&D, only once but I had fun.

I'm 28, pretty pale, tattoos on one arm, overweight, introvert, and I don't know many people around here. I don't get out too much, never really liked going places alone, always seemed funner with someone else. I'm looking for that person who can be my best friend. If you're going to fall in love with someone who better than your best friend. I'm not one to take relationships fast, there's no point in moving fast, if things work out you'll be together for a long time anyways, so you have plenty of time.

I'm not too particular about looks, what matters most to be is what in your head. You don't have to be outspoken or outgoing, or anything really. Just be nice and either have similar interests, they don't have to be exactly the same, or be okay with my interests. Be okay with spending some days around the house watching tv, or working on a project together. I do like the outdoors, but unlike everyone else on the internet, I'm not going to say i spend every waking moment outside.

Here are some things about me that some people seem to care about for some reason. I do have my own car (if you didn't surmise that from me loving to work on it). I am educated, I have a AA in IT, and working on A+ cert right now (first test is 1 week away!). Not working, studying. 4-6 hours a day dedicated to studying so i can get a good job in IT.

I think that about does it, I can't really think of anything else to write. So yeah, here's hoping something good actually comes from this...

Andrew

I remember finding her online and we hit it off right away having a lot in common so we decided to meet. When I met up with her we talked and got to know each other and for the most part we completely hit it off physically as well. I saw her regularly and we shared staying at each other's place since we both had roommates. After spending the first week with her I realized she wasn't doing so well financially and starting selling things to pay bills and buy food. This worried me because when I asked her about how she paid for rent she said this had been going on for a couple of months. She told me she burned through her savings and was to the point of selling her car to get by for another few more months. She really wasn't trying to talk about it and was really embarrassed but I assured her that we all go through ups and downs and this was just one of the many roadblocks in life. I really cared about her at this point so I asked her if I could help her out and she smiled and nodded her head with a refreshed look. I remember her laughing and saying that she couldn't believe she was in an arrangement with a guy she met on the INTERNET. She also was surprised how lucky she was to find me and that she never thought about doing anything like this ever before. She heard about sugar daddy sites and her cousin was a stripper in college but never did she think to do this to help pay the bills. The nice thing about our relationship was that everything felt so natural even though it wasn't your typical setup. I'm hoping I can find that type of relationship with another great girl out there as this has been years since this happened.

I'm just a normal guy in my late twenties with most of my stuff together (career, degree, and car). I grew up playing sports so I'm pretty athletic. I'm actually tall and over six feet. Most girls I've met say I'm handsome and attractive so don't think I'm just saying that. :) I'm a mix of backgrounds but mainly American. I travel a lot so I hope you're the type who likes to fly away occasionally. Of course there is so much more about me and I hope you're interested in knowing more about me. I have never been married and don't have any children. I do most of my fun activities socially. She would have to be between the ages of eighteen and twenty six. I'm patient and understanding so I know how to respect all limits and boundaries when doing something like this together.

I've been in enough relationships (long term) to know what I want and how to express my wants and needs. Semi-amusing guy looking to meet an intelligent, positive-attitudinal, single woman with whom to do fun stuff, go on trips, and, if everything lines up, create a great long-term relationship.


About me: I'm actually, no-kidding, completely single, not married or involved and looking for action on the side. I'm tall (6'2"), lean, and in great shape. I just turned 60, and I'm happy to say that I'm definitely ahead of the curve as far as holding up well physically. I'd love to take all the credit -- I work out regularly and have a reasonable diet -- but I think the genes have a lot to do with it. Brown eyes and a full head of salt-and-pepper hair. Light drinking. No smoking. Easygoing and friendly. Mostly liberal politically. Master's degreed. If you're into astrology, I'm an Aquarius. According to the theory, I'm compatible with Aries, Gemini, Libra, Sagittarius, and Aquarius. If you're into the Myers-Briggs, I'm an ENTP. No kids.


About you: You're charming, pleasant, and easygoing, with a good sense of humor and in good shape physically. I know that big women are beautiful and sexy and fantastic; it's just a personal preference, and I'm not asking for anything that I myself cannot deliver. You're probably in your 40s or 50s and college educated. You might live in Berkeley or Oakland, or even SF or Marin, but, realistically, the peninsula or San Jose or Napa is just too far. All that driving will make us insane. Maybe you have kids, but you have the time and space in your life for a relationship, e.g., reliable co-parenting. Not a workaholic. You're looking to create the long-term emotional, physical, and intellectual relationship you've always wanted, with a man who shares your values of honesty, trust, and open communication. I know, sounds boring, but of such mundane elements are strong relationships made.


Still reading? Excellent! Let's see, travel-wise, there are a lot of places I want to go, e.g., South America and the South Pacific. Plenty of places in Europe I haven't been. British Isles, ditto. I saw a thing about a cruise to Antarctica, which sounds really interesting and exotic. I like to go to the movies, leaning toward less mainstream films. Nice restaurants and holes-in-the-wall. Music, including a variety of live music: jazz, rock, the symphony . . . Occasional theater, museums, etc. Little hiking/walking -- few miles. Talking about everything. Or nothing. There's cool stuff on TV, but I'm not into vegging out every night; prefer going out and doing fun, interesting stuff at least a few times a week.


I know it feels a little strange meeting someone online, but I figure it's a good way to meet people you'd never have met otherwise. Worst case: we don't click, but we still spend an enjoyable hour together over coffee. Unfortunately, it's hard to get any meaningful idea as to what really matters about a person from words and photos on your computer screen (no app for that), but it's a start. I figure that if we like each others' words and pictures and have a good phone call, then meeting over coffee is an easy way to see if there's a potential connection. You never know, could turn into a fantastic relationship.


If any of this piques your interest, I'd love to hear from you, and please include a reasonably clear, reasonably recent photo. Or, if you want to write first, then send your pic after I reply, that's fine, too. It's definitely a good idea to exchange photos fairly early on, though. Once again, please email me at "dave123 (at) pacbell (dot) net" instead of the link above. I'm trying to avoid the spam-bots (never fun on coffee dates).


Yrs,

Dave

title: Realness: Never Settle For Less
text:
Let's be real, your looks will attract me but your mind and spirit will keep me around. It gets very tiresome trying to meet people out and about. You meet plenty of people who are looking for a good time and just want to "hang out" and everyone seems to have the same things to say and the same intentions. Not what I'm looking for anymore. Been there, done that. Some qualities that I value in a person are adventurous, loyalty, intelligence, patience, integrity and humor - in every sense of the word. I'm the type of person who finds humor and joy in everything. I look for those same characteristics as well because in my opinion, without humor, laughter and acceptance, life would be pretty dull!

I'm genuine and straight-forward, what you see is what you get. •No baggage •Don't smoke •Never married •No kids: prefer the same. I'm friendly, loyal and gentle. I tend to be go-with-flow, easy going and good-natured. I'm not into drama or mind games: I have purpose and intention with how I live my life and intentionally hurting others is not one. I enjoy music, movies, sports, binge-watching shows, deep conversation or just chatting at a coffee shop and so much more. I have a connection to the outdoors, conscious living. I like to take off into the mountains or along the ocean and see the wonderment of nature in everything. I'm cultured and love learning new things especially something from everyone I meet. I'm grateful for each interaction in life and appreciate when one opens up to me and shares.

I'm looking for someone with good values to build with whom I feel a nice, genuine connection while not rushing into anything, taking things at whatever speed feels natural and see where it lands. That said, as I'm not a serial dater nor am I into meaningless hookups, I am looking for that lady that possess the potential to be "the one". Someone to laugh at my jokes, experiment with new things and introduce me to things that mean a lot to them. I am looking to share my life as well as understand theirs. I am warm, compassionate, honest and extremely independent. Things I value in a relationship: equality, knowing yourself and what you want and need, honesty, self-confidence and self-respect.

Nothing Worth Having Is Easy: You're responsible with your declarations, promises and back those words up with actions. You have self-awareness and self-knowledge to understand when words flutter out your mouth, having the decency to follow through with them. Trust, loyalty and love are all earned. You don't get them just because you're a good person. Doing right is the standard, and though it's appreciated, you don't get extra credit for it. I just believe there's more to being a "good one" than just being a good person. Your presence should improve things, and your energy should inspire. If we're going to be close, we should be making each other better. I don't believe in keeping people around for no reason. Your presence should have a purpose. I want to feel honored to know you.

I want to hear from you with a pic for a response if you're a fun down to earth lady that wants to find a chill guy to spend time with to build a great friendship that can lead to a life time partnership. I dislike the games and won't chase you: I feel like it should be mutual and think life is way too short to play them and beat around the bush so when you like someone you should dive straight in. I respect a lady who knows what she wants, goes after it and has no problems putting it out there. If you have a desire to get to know someone on a deep, meaningful level, and want to put the effort into communicating and seeing each other, sharing ideas, having discussion and not relying solely on text messages but rather use it in conjunction with calling when getting to know someone. Not feeling all that dating nonsense either. If it's right, it should be casual and fun, easy to maintain and contain laughter and a mutual pursuit of our passions.

I only want real people around me...That really want to be around me...This is when you really care enough to call to each other out if sliding off track so I respect someone who can keep me accountable. A healthy relationship is one where two individuals strive to make each other better to become the best version of themselves they can be.

I am looking for someone easy to talk to. Someone I could cozy up with and watch a movie with, instead of sitting alone on my couch surfing the web. title: Duality. It's dangers, downfalls and rewards.
text:
How dare you let your mind stray! You've come to finally realize that you no longer (or never really had) the emotional, physical and intellectual connection at home. Instead of making the ultimate effort to break through his filters and speak to him in an emotional yet rational way, you fall victim to your own personal desires. An addictive and haunting feeling, to reach out into the void and seek supplementation. You really should feel ashamed but you are numb to it. You simply don't care. 

Truth of the matter is, I'm pushing/breaking the limits of hypocrisy. You and I are card carrying members of both an illusive and exclusive club. The lost romantics, the malcontents, the ones who refuse to believe that the adrenaline rush and feelings of infatuation are now behind us for good. We are the ones who dream of awakening every morning to a heartfelt email, sent from a secret source. Far beyond the scope of your partner, still asleep in bed. Somehow you have a feeling of connection, like you are physically closer to your secret lover than you are to your man. Even in the physical realm.

The 10 minutes before work begins, the lunch break, the afternoon slump. No source of caffeine can provide the energy needed to perform at your best. How you and I both wish that during these moments, we could look down, see an email waiting and hope that it contains words of passion and excitement. The only source to truly put us on our feet and drive through the day as if we were on autopilot. 

In my 36 years, I've felt ultimate love and terrible loss. I've felt the electrifying feeling of newfound friendship as well as the tragedy of it not being allowed to come to fruition. At certain turning points in my life, I've been drained of all emotion. That said, I'm either blessed or cursed with my inner ability to generate excess love and energy. The ultimate desire for connection be it physical, virtual or spiritual. 

With all this energy I carry, I'm free to cast it into the void, to find equal yet oppositely charged energy. A critical mass created between two human beings, unafraid to open our eyes to the face of danger. With one hand gripping earth for safety, we are unafraid of taking each other's hand, walking to the edge of the cliff and peering beyond. To see the crashing waves against the rocks, the source of our rare yet powerful emotions. The search we've conducted for a lifetime, at an end.
