title: Neuroscience and breastmilk
text:
I prefer a natural approach to finding solutions to just about any problem. The synthetic world we have created and exist within only creates a vicious circle of treatments, no desire to seek ultimate solutions. 

When speaking to a neurologist, I was able to achieve a rare exchange, something beyond the limits of Doctor/patient dialogue. The truth at last, at great risk to trusted source. 

Seeking sources of effective neuroprotectants, I was told that a natural diet combined with consumption of raw, high cbd cannabis would be one end of the spectrum. Unfortunately, I choose not to accept this at my point in life. 

The other end of the spectrum, even more shocking and (to me) controversial would be the consumption of a mothers breastmilk. Aside from the fact that, by design, it's the worlds greatest superfood, the stem cells contained within provide healing and growth beyond scientific measure. 

Having troubled myself with the question, the related taboo and the sheer gravity of such a thing, I've come to accept the fact that both breastmilk combined with the bond between two people equal ultimate healing of both the body and soul. 

A unique and open soul, I seek the nurturing exchange of healing energy, two entities on opposite ends of the spectrum, bringing each other into a state of balance. 

Allow me to reach out and form a connection, an understanding between two people. The foundation only a dialogue away.

title: Society of The Lost Romantics
text:
The Society of Lost Romantics. 

An elusive (but not exclusive) club in which membership requires an unfortunate set of circumstance and sacrifice.We are the ones who suffer the burden of carrying our romantic energy along with us wherever we may go. Our significant others unwilling to help shoulder the burden. 

Years have passed and the deep bond and loving connection that seemed commonplace is now described to us by the actions of our spouse as an acquired taste. Something only palatable on rare occasion. (For the fellow gentlemen seeking a place within this club, I am not referring to sex)! Alas, the love we carry only grows exponentially, never to be cherished by another. 

We extend our hands, seeking the warm embrace of the one who was once our equal. Although intangible, we receive the hand of our cosmic ideal. Our loving partner, our equal, our soulmate. Hand in virtual hand, we continue walking our path. Head over heels in love with the idea of being in love. 

We, the members of the Lost Romantics Society exist in every walk of life. We congregate in our dreams, children of every country of this earth. We come in all shapes, colors and sizes. From the project manager offering proposal to the mechanic draining oil from your vehicle. From the mother and lonely housewife to the NASA engineer. 

Contrary to belief, our society does not consist of the morally weak or the self serving manipulators. We only seek romance from within our society, to make contact with our fellow members. To strengthen the foundation of our orginazation and to bring wholesomeness and romantic fulfillment to our members. 

There are countless men and women, all of whom are lost romantics. They stand in que, waiting to submit themselves to initiation. What they don't know is this is a society which requires no such initiation, only the will and open heart. The utmost desire to heal. The willingness to shoulder half the burden of another and melt into a world of peace, romance and ultimate fulfillment. 


Wishing fellow members the most magical of days,

X

However, winter is still with us: still dark too early, the weather is still sporadically cold or clammy, and Donald Trump's hairpiece is still busy collecting nuts to bury for the rest of winter, etc. But there are some glimmers of hope as a few members from the Clown Car of the GOP Presidential Candidates have already left the circus. 

Although I'm originally from NYC, and have lived here for many years, I still have an accent that could make Marisa Tomei jealous. I suspect my trips back east for my annual dose of turkey and family drama with my Italian-American family might have something to do with that. Of course, I keep my visits short--longer than a week and it can start to resemble a bad episode of "Everybody Loves Raymond."

Kidding aside, it would be nice to possibly usher the burgeoning spring with someone new of the opposite sex. But these Craigslist ads are always a little awkward. Still, I guess it's better than trying to run my shopping cart into that of that cute gal in the produce section of Safeway. My luck, she'll be a personal liability lawyer and looking to slap a personal injury lawsuit on me-- and having a boyfriend, to boot. ("Clean up in aisle 9, please!")

I am an energetic, intelligent, single white male with a good heart and a sense of whimsy. Sensible and responsible, people find they usually can depend on me. I am single, 5'8", of medium build, and living in Sunnyvale. I only smoke when set on fire and my idea of buying crack is hiring my local plumber. At 58 yrs it seems that my youthful appearance, attitude and energy sometimes fool people (although in "dog years", I should be dead!), so for now, I think I'll continue tossing those AARP advertisements in the trash. 

I enjoy the "usual suspects" that most do: movies, concerts, BBQs, traveling, as well as others not listed. While not a marathon biker or hiker, I do like to occasionally hop on the bicycle for a ride around town or a walk along a trail. But if going to a party, fine dining or a night in town is your speed, I am usually up for that as well. Adept in the kitchen, I can be trusted with handling sharp knives and hot surfaces without frantic calls to 911 or Poison Control. 

I don't want to rattle off a laundry list of "must haves", esp. it has been my experience that the women that I have been fortunate to have involved with in the past all don't fit the same mold. Rather, I can probably tell you what qualities I historically have related best with: innate sweetness and decency; intelligence and common sense; a sense of humor and not taken to overly dramatic histrionics over small setbacks. Physically, I'm not particularly looking for Barbie, but I'd hope she'd not be three jelly donuts away from affecting the tides, either. In a perfect world, she would have a waist line smaller than mine.

Below are photos of me. Since I posted my photos for the entire world to see, it would be nice if you at least sent one privately. If any of this resonates with you and you think it might be worthwhile to initiate a conversation, feel free to drop me a note. And to separate the real responses from the "spam bots" that want to sell me sell me pornographic webcam links, Viagra or male enhancement aids (I hope I'm not the only guy getting these!), please put the words "With Trump there will be hell toupee" in your subject line.

title: You are so damn beautiful
text:
A time comes in your life when you finally "get it . . !!!!" When in the midst of all your fears and insanity you stop------ dead in your tracks and somewhere, the voice inside your head cries out ENOUGH! Enough fighting and crying, or struggling to hold on, and, like a child quieting down after a blind tantrum, your sobs begin to subside, you shudder once or twice, you blink back your tears and 
through a mantle of wet lashes, you begin to look at the world through new eyes. 

This is your awakening... 
You realize that it's time to stop hoping and waiting for something to change, or for happiness, safety and security to come galloping over the next horizon. You come to terms with the fact that she is not Cinderella and you are not Prince Charming and that in the real world, there aren't always fairy tale endings (or beginnings for that matter) and that any guarantee of "happily ever after" must begin with you and in the process, a sense of serenity is born of acceptance. You awaken to the fact that you are not perfect and that not everyone will always love, appreciate or approve of who or what you are . . . and that's OK. (They are entitled to their own views and opinions.) And you learn the importance of loving and championing yourself and in the process, a sense of new found confidence is born of self-approval. 

You stop complaining and blaming other people for the things they did to you (or didn't do for you) and you learn that the only thing you can really count on is the unexpected. You learn that people don't always say what they mean or mean what they say and that not everyone will always be there for you and that it's not always about you. So, you learn to stand on your own and to take care of yourself and in the process, a sense of safety & security is born of self-reliance. You stop judging and pointing fingers and you begin to accept people as they are and to overlook their shortcomings and human frailties and in the process, a sense of peace & contentment is born of forgiveness. 
You realize that much of the way you view yourself and the world around you, is a result of all the messages and opinions that have been ingrained into your psyche. 
You begin to sift through all the junk you've been fed about how you should behave, how you should look and how much you should weigh, what you should wear and where you should shop and what you should drive, how and where you should live and what you should do for a living, who you should marry and what you should expect of a marriage, the importance of having and raising children or what you owe your parents. You learn to open up to new worlds and different points of view. You begin reassessing and redefining who you are and what you really stand for. 

You learn the difference between wanting and needing and you begin to discard the doctrines and values you've outgrown, or should never have bought into to begin with and in the process, you learn to go with your instincts. You learn that it is truly in giving that we receive and that there is power and glory in creating and contributing and you stop maneuvering through life merely as a "consumer" looking for your next fix. You learn that principles such as honesty and integrity are not the outdated ideals of a by gone era, but the mortar that holds together the foundation upon which you must build a life. You learn that you don't know everything; it's not your job to save the world and that you can't teach a pig to sing. You learn to distinguish between guilt and responsibility and the importance of setting boundaries and learning to say NO. You learn that the only cross to bear is the one you choose to carry and that martyrs get burned at the stake. 

Then you learn about love, romantic love and familial love, how to love, how much to give in love, when to stop giving and when to walk away. You learn not to project your needs or your feelings onto a relationship. You learn that you will not be more beautiful, more intelligent, more lovable or important because of the man on your arm or the child that bears your name. You learn to look at relationships as they really are and not as you would have them be. You stop trying to control people, situations and outcomes. You learn that just as people grow and change, so it is with love; and you learn that you don't have the right to demand love on your terms, just to make you happy. You learn that alone does not mean lonely. You look in the mirror and come to terms with the fact that you will never be a perfect 10 and you stop trying to compete with the image inside your head and 
agonizing over how you "stack up." 

You also stop working so hard at putting your feelings aside, smoothing things over and ignoring your needs. You learn that feelings of entitlement are perfectly OK and that it is your right, to want things and to ask for the things that you want and that sometimes it is necessary to make demands. You come to the realization that you deserve to be treated with love, kindness, sensitivity and respect and you won't settle for less. You allow only the hands of a lover who cherishes you, to glorify you with their touch and in the process; you internalize the meaning of self-respect. 
And you learn that your body really is your temple. And you begin to care for it and treat it with respect. 
You begin eating a balanced diet, drinking more water and taking more time to exercise. You learn that fatigue diminishes the spirit and can create doubt and fear. So you take more time to rest. Just as food fuels the body, laughter fuels our soul; so you take more time to laugh and to play. 

You learn that for the most part in life, you get what you believe you deserve and that much of life truly is a self-fulfilling prophecy. You learn that anything worth achieving is worth working for and that 
wishing for something to happen, is different from working toward making it happen. 

More importantly, you learn that in order to achieve success you need direction, discipline and perseverance. You also learn that no one can do it all alone and that it's OK to risk asking for help. You learn that the only thing you must truly fear is the great robber baron of all time; FEAR itself. You learn to step right into and through your fears, because you know that whatever happens you can handle it and to give in to fear, is to give away the right to live life on your terms. 

You learn to fight for your life and not to squander it living under a cloud of impending doom. You learn that life isn't always fair, you don't always get what you think you deserve and that sometimes bad things happen to unsuspecting, good people. On these occasions, you learn not to personalize things. You learn that God isn't punishing you or failing to answer your prayers; it's just life happening. 

You learn to deal with evil in its most primal state; the ego. You learn that negative feelings such as anger, envy and resentment must be understood and redirected or they will suffocate the life out of you and poison the universe that surrounds you. You learn to admit when you are wrong and to build bridges instead of walls. 
You learn to be thankful and to take comfort in many of the simple things we take for granted; things that millions of people upon the earth can only dream about; a full refrigerator, clean running water, a soft warm bed, a long hot shower. Slowly, you begin to take responsibility for yourself, by yourself and you make yourself a promise to never betray yourself and to never ever settle for less than your heart's desire. You hang a wind chime outside your window so you can listen to the wind, and you make it a point to keep smiling, to keep trusting and to stay open to every wonderful possibility. 

Finally, with courage in your heart and with God by your side you take a stand, you take a deep breath and you begin to design the life you want to live as best as you can. You know why? Because you are so damn beautiful and I want to be your lover and your friend, and be wherever you are in your peaceful light.

title: Holly Golightly was ahead of her time
text:
So, I'm sitting here trying to imagine what you look like naked and what your thoughts are on spankings.

I've always been of the opinion that the character of Audrey Hepburn played in Breakfast At Tiffany's would have gotten quite an erotic charge out of a nice bare-bottomed smacking. Holly Golightly was indeed ahead of her time. Perhaps due to the fact that it was adapted from a Truman Capote novella.

Truman was gay, and gay (I'm heterosexual) men have always been on the cutting edge of both fashion and sexual mores. Truman, incidentally, died from choking on a pill bottle cap when his young boy toy lover would not come to his assistance because he thought the old queen was just trying to lure him in there to have it off with him again.

Flannery O'Conner died of lupus.

I don't know which is a worse way to go. As for me, I hope it's in my sleep, at 140, in bed with my twin, twenty-two-year-old girlfriends Fantasy & Ecstasy.

But enough of this morbid talk! How are you? A hedonist? A progressive? I'm all for progressiveness. As long as they don't put our brains in pickle jars and freeze them like they did to the Splendid Splinter, Ted Williams, now known as Teddy Popsicle.

Unless it would be like Woody Allen in Sleeper and we'd wake up in a world with Orgasmatrons---or is this already in the works?

I read an article a few days ago about a new device a doctor in England invented that, when implanted at the small of the back, can cause her to have an orgasm at the touch of a button. Something about neural stimulation or some such nonsense. Needless to say, gals aren't lining up to get them installed. Imagine if you had one and someone got a hold of it and decided to have a little fun with you. Or what if it started going off whenever you pushed the automatic garage door opener? 

Technology opens up myriads of new social and cultural problems for which we have no answers yet.

As for me, I enjoy going to the ballpark, but I'd rather be in the bedroom with a pretty woman.

I'm not adverse to toys though. Toys can be quick fun (the organic kind you find in the veggie dept. at your nearest Safeway store). I look at them as sort of sexual action figures. "Here goes Captain Splooie", etc, etc.

Well, if you enjoy these random thoughts---shoot me an email and a photo and maybe we can really start laughing, kissing, undressing, and spending some electric moments and movements together wondering how in the fuck we have gone so long without knowing each other.

title: If We Click...
text:
I'm seeking a mature, formally educated female, perhaps a onetime flower child (who no longer does drugs), a woman with a nurturing and artistic side, who prefers deep conversations to sports (except maybe bedroom sports), is aware and concerned politically, evolved psychologically and eager to share memorable adventures on short notice. I'm a kindhearted, witty ex New Yorker with a strong body, generous nature and cute dimples. I have sophisticated tastes, good manners and a lust for life. I look and act younger than my years and go to great lengths to stay healthy. I'm divorced, unattached and disposed to have a mutually satisfying long-term relationship. Friendship first, of course. 

Hopefully, like me, you'll be somewhat of a culture buff. You enjoy watching top-rated s films, documentaries especially, touring art museums and galleries, listening to live jazz, attending bookstore lectures, sightseeing and listening to NPR. You routinely read enlightening reading publications such as The New York Times and New Yorker magazine. 

If we click, we can explore ethnic restaurants, seek out live music performances, take hikes to Pt. Reyes, etc. It would be wonderful to have someone special to share such activities with, wouldn't it? I prefer the company of a divorced mother around my age or younger. Like you, I have my sensitivities. I prefer the company of deep women to the company of shallow women. I prefer being with a woman who takes good care of her body and exercises to keep fit. A woman with excellent manners scores bonus points with me. 

If you qualify, I promise you a lifetime of fun, loyalty, intellectual, spiritual and monogamous stimulation--who knows, maybe even "marriage" (we can draw up our own contract)--not to mention gourmet dishes that drive you wild with pleasure. Frequent warm hugs and a sympathetic ear too. Satisfaction not guaranteed, but I promise to do my best. This offer expires when I am snatched up or whenever I myself expire, whichever comes first. 

Despite the playful tone of this posting, I am seeking a dedicated intimate partner. I am pro feminist, environmentally and politically aware and open to developing emotional and physical intimacy. I tend to connect best with women who have borne and nurtured children.

title: Do you have a wild side?
text:
Let's see, where do I start? Well you must be a student, drama free, not too much into drugs, fun and extremely spontaneous. I will generously donate to your favorite charity each week as I hope you have a lot of extra time. I hope to meet someone sweet, cute and fun. Perhaps you're too reluctant to take that next step or don't have someone you trust to see that wild side in you? 

Do you have a secret preference for certain men but would never have the courage to admit it to anyone or take the plunge and let him know? If the answer is "yes," we DEFINITELY need to talk. If this is what you've been secretly looking for than please email me and let's give this a whirl. What do you have to lose? ABOUT ME: I'm 32, tall, Caucasian mixed with some Latin. I work in a professional environment. I drink socially, I don't do nor have I ever experimented with hardcore drugs, and I'm absolutely STD free. I'm handsome, well groomed, charming, intelligent and personable. Why not send me an email and perhaps we can chat. Life is short, why waste it? I'm down-to-earth, financially-stable, and normal in every sense.

Perhaps, I can be the prescription of excitement you've been secretly looking for. Maybe, you wouldn't mind having a safe, secret and exciting guy who you could trust and have some intimate fun with while getting a stipend at the same time? Maybe, you just want to know what it feels again to be desired, wanted, yearned for by someone and to have those "butterflies" in your stomach when you kiss. Don't worry, I'm not looking to get married. I'm not looking for you to change your life. I'm honestly looking for an arrangement and understanding.

Maybe we can find a way to have both of our needs met in the here and now and then later if you decide this arrangement isn't working for you anymore, it can end and we can both go our separate ways with a positive outcome. Another option is we can stay friends with benefits ongoing for the long term. Whatever ends up working out I guess we'll find out either way? My question at this point is do you stress out on finances? Are you worried about how you are going to make rent or pay your mortgage this month? Did your car just break down and you don't have the money to fix it?

Maybe you're in a relationship with someone who makes you feel undesirable, who makes you feel unsexy? Again, I'm a generous man who just turned 32, and needs more than a single girl can give me at this point in time. I'm not really picky with looks but unlike some shallow guys, I understand beauty is more than a picture of a supermodel and can be found in all shapes and sizes. I've been around long enough to know what I want and how to express it. My fears and flaws are deep and many but I'm healthy and trying hard to keep it that way. Isn't it time that you receive the love and attention you deserve?

title: Nerdy guy seeking nerdy girl
text:
I'm a nerdy guy in a few different ways. I like my videogames (RPG's being one of my favorite genres). I like my anime (Hellsing Ultimate, Naruto Shippuden, Full Metal Alchemist, Hajime No Ippo, Summer Wars, Chobits, the list goes on). I also geek out about cars sometimes, I love working on my car. I like to build random things with my Arduino (I'm working on a 16x16 multiplexed LED array right now). I also enjoy tabletop games be it classics like Risk or Monopoly. newer ones like Pandemic or Dead of Winter. I have even dabbled in a bit of D&D, only once but I had fun. 

I'm 28, pretty pale, tattoos on one arm, overweight, introvert, and I don't know many people around here. I don't get out too much, never really liked going places alone, always seemed funner with someone else. I'm looking for that person who can be my best friend. If you're going to fall in love with someone who better than your best friend. I'm not one to take relationships fast, there's no point in moving fast, if things work out you'll be together for a long time anyways, so you have plenty of time. 

I'm not too particular about looks, what matters most to be is what in your head. You don't have to be outspoken or outgoing, or anything really. Just be nice and either have similar interests, they don't have to be exactly the same, or be okay with my interests. Be okay with spending some days around the house watching tv, or working on a project together. I do like the outdoors, but unlike everyone else on the internet, I'm not going to say i spend every waking moment outside. 

Here are some things about me that some people seem to care about for some reason. I do have my own car (if you didn't surmise that from me loving to work on it). I am educated, I have a AA in IT, and working on A+ cert right now (first test is 1 week away!). Not working, studying. 4-6 hours a day dedicated to studying so i can get a good job in IT.

I think that about does it, I can't really think of anything else to write. If you want a pic just ask, I never really liked posting pics to CL. So yeah, here's hoping something good actually comes from this...

Andrew

title: hot, toned and helpful
text:
When he first met her, she was a braided twist of nameless anxieties -- dark fears of the unknown -- wrapped around a core of aching desire. 

Unable or unwilling to say "no," but too frightened to say "yes," she could quiet neither her cravings nor her hesitations.

She needed time, she said. Time to "sort things out."

But life isn't like that, he told her. Life isn't a three act play; things will never be sorted out.

You take what you need when you find it. If you wait for certainty, the thing you need may be gone.

Alchemy . . . "the process of taking something ordinary and turning it into something extraordinary, sometimes in a way that cannot be explained." This means I'm looking for a loving, caring, long term relationship with a single, funny, smart, educated woman with an irresistible charming personality, sense of adventure, and lots of common sense. 

When you pair up with someone and live through the day to day challenges of accepting, loving, and living with another person, you have the opportunity to create a beautiful life together out of the ordinary act of living rather than trying to "borrow" excitement, prestige, wealth, youth, or any other characteristic from the other person via "chemistry."

I am 6' tall, charismatic, broad shoulders, hazel-brown eyes, handsome, adventurous, funny, educated, sensual, cute, cultured, and a young working professional. I love traveling, languages, experiencing different cultures and food, helping others, giving back to the community, continuously learning, cooking, music, all things outdoors, keeping fit, and others. I believe that a successful relationship must have at a minimum the following elements:

1) Constant and honest communication - being vulnerable 
2) Zero lies, stealing, manipulating, trickery, or unethical behavior -- that means no white lies either
3) No screaming, violence or abuse of any kind -- there is never any reason for this.
4) An attitude of mutual reconciliation and a desire to makes things work

I'm looking for someone:

* who supports my career vision and allows me to support theirs
* with whom I can grow with and change together
* who shares my values (family, moral, others)
* who reminds me that I am not my accomplishments nor my degree(s), not my paycheck, not my job title, and especially not for my inheritance (I don't have one btw)
* who loves me for who I am 
* who remembers that it's important that we love one another not because of what we have done but because of who we are
* who wants to grow old and wrinkly together
* with whom I can adventure through life with as we grow and change, and with whom I can create something beautiful, extraordinary, and sometimes hard to explain
* who has no or minimal emotional baggage

If this interests you, then to be fair, please write more than one line about yourself, share the basics (name, age, height, etc.), interests, what resonated with you, what you are looking for, what you have been doing with your life as well as where you'd like to go, any questions you have, and include a pic or two and I'll do the same. 

I just moved from the east coast to Los Angeles, CA but I'm in San Francisco frequently for work. I'm willing to move there or anywhere for the right person so please don't let the distance be a deterrent to exploring if we might be right for each other.

I look forward to hearing from you.
facial hair: none - but could have if you want

I would like to find someone to put a smile on my face. A woman that inspires me to do the extra mile or extra set of weights.

title: Taken and lacking intimacy seeks same.
text:
Hello ladies of Craigslist,

I realize just by the title how scummy my proposition sounds, but please be kind and just move on if this isn't for you...

I'm a 30ish year old male with a great career and a baggage free life. I'm currently dating a great girl who's, for the most part, got her stuff together and a great head on her shoulders. However, she's currently job seeking in an extremely aggressive and competitive industry and for the last 8 months (and counting) has had absolutely no luck. She's been really busy and stressed out which has taken a toll on our relationship, mostly just in the bedroom. We don't fight and she's not a jealous or possessive person, but we're at a point in our relationship where sex is rare and even when it happens, it's more of a chore than anything else. We don't live together and we only see each other 1 or 2 days a week, sometimes every other week. Needless to say, those days don't usually include sex since most of it is just eating out and listening to her vent her frustrations. She is a great girl though and I'm happy with her so I don't plan to leave the relationship.

A man has needs and I know women do too. What I'm worried about is the lack of sex will lead to resentment and eventually a breakup. I'm hoping I can find a woman who's got a good man, but doesn't want to fall out of the relationship. Perhaps he's a businessman who travels often, or maybe he's got opposite work schedules so you two rarely see each other. Whatever your case may be, you're starving for some intimacy and attention. If this sounds like you, maybe we can help each other out. Discretion would certainly be a must for the both of us and an understanding that this may or may not last very long would be helpful as well.

I'm fairly open to all women who might be interested and I have a broad taste in all women. I just ask that you're mature enough to remain discreet and that you're free of any sexually transmittable infections, dormant or active. I work in healthcare so I'm all too familiar, but you can expect that I'm completely free of diseases. I also have no problem taking an STD test if that'll offer peace of mind. I don't do drugs or smoke, and I drink occasionally in social events. I've been described as a nice and caring person, very respectful, and a fun person to have in one's company.

If you're at all interested, I'd love to hear from you. We can exchange emails and work our way into a comfortable connection before meeting in person. I'll be as much of an open book as possible, but some personal things will probably remain private. I'll respect whatever you want to keep secret from me as well. Hope to hear from you soon and enjoy Super Bowl 50!

title: What do you do when marrital bliss goes STALE?
text:
The sad reality is that marital life gets stale. . .. It gets routine. . . and it gets boring. Kids, work, social commitments and all aspects of life pile up and next think you know intimacy, passion and sensuality are pushed aside. Some call it "the RUTT"... others call it complacency. . . but whatever you call It, it SUCKS.

Well I am in THE RUTT". . .. I am in a sexless, passionless, boring marriage and feel as though I have tried numerous ways to "splice things up". . . none of which worked.

However, as of late my eyes have been opened to the fact that I am not alone in this and am now at the point where I want to explore ways to fill this voild. . . to find that passion, that lust, that sensuality that I crave so deeply.

My issue, however, is that I have no clue how to find those women who are in the same boat. I mean what does one do? Go to a bar? A club? Not likely! Do I try to hit on the moms in my neighborhood? My kids sports teams? School parents? Co workers? No thanks. . . way to close to home.

So here I am.. posting in CL land. The land of (or what seems to be the land of) freak shows, prostitutes and folks with scary fetishes. . .. Posting just hoping that there is at least one sane, sensual woman out there in a similar situation and open to the possibilities of fun with a man such as me. Someone craving passion and intimacy.

If that is you. . . drop me an email and lets start a dialogue. It can start via email. . . and then maybe evolve into a face to face encounter. . . and then who knows where else it could go.

Hope to hear from you.

title: Looking for a "Play Partner" not an Affair
text:
As I sit here ready to embark on my CL journey I find myself wondering what fun just might come my way. Believe it or not I can say that CL has come through for me in the past and allowed me to find a situation that, at least for a time, got me what I was looking for. However, as they say, past performance is not indicative of future results, so I walk down this path again optimistic but cautious. So here goes. . .

A LITTLE ABOUT ME:
Caucasian male. . . mid to late 30's. . .. married. . . just over 6 feet tall and somewhere around 215 lbs. Fun, engaging, sarcastic, sexy, sensual and allways respectful. Employed. . . and live in the east bay.

WHAT I AM LOOKING FOR:
A "Play partner". I have intentionally not used the "A" word (affair if you are curious) because I think that brings with it baggage. What I am NOT looking for is a traditional relationship. . . very few if any dinners, movies, walks on the beach, etc. What I am looking for is a like-minded woman in a similar situation that finds herself craving sexual attention. Craving to kiss and be kissed. To touch and be touched. Craving intimacy, connection. . . the excitement of that first kiss. . . the exhilaration of feeling two warm bodies pressed against one another. I am not looking to play games. . .. Not looking for drama. . . but rather looking for a honest upfront individual who is willing to say this is what I want and is able to go get it. I am looking for a woman that is missing that spark at home. . .. Someone who is generally happy with their marriage but is missing the passion... the exhilaration of the first kiss... the anticipation of an encounter. Someone who is sick of the "lets just get this over with" attitude about sex.

MY REQUIREMENTS
As I said above I am married and being honest DO NOT want to change that. . . so first and foremost DISCRETION is a must. Second. . .Honesty. Third.. Chemistry. . . and Lastly. . .Attraction. As for what I am attracted to. Frankly, I am realistic enough to know that my fantasy girl (think swimsuit model.. or Barbie) isn't going to fall into my lap. And quite frankly I don't want that. I am a fan of the female body. . .. All type. To me attraction is in the eye of the beholder, however, attraction starts with self-confidence. So all I ask is that you be confident enough in your skin to be willing (when the time is right) to rock what you got. Be willing to flaunt it. . . not ashamed to show off those few extra lbs. . . after all remember I am in the same boat. . . I assure you, I am not morbidly obese but at the same time I am not a model myself.

WHAT NEXT
It starts with a simple email. If you find yourself intrigued drop me a line. . . tell me a little bit about yourself. . . ideally attach a picture.. Responses with pictures will get first look. . . however I understand the hesitancy to throw digital images out in cyberspace right off the bat so if you prefer to hold off on that I do understand. That's it.. From there I see us exchanging a few emails, discussing our thoughts, desires and cravings and then seeing what transpires. . .

Tempted? I hope so. . .

Bye for now

text:

We do get a long for the most part, but like most couples, we have our ups and downs. The only down that has remained a 'down' is our sex life. Not only is it sparse, but pretty plain as well. You might ask, why not just leave and find someone more compatible? Good question, with a not so easy answer. 

I know there are women out there in a similar situation to mine. I've met them before and we've shared some really good times together. Something about being in a same situation and having that full honesty knowing about each others spouse made things click really well. When the time came for things to end, they always seem to have ended gracefully. Maybe because of that openness and honesty?

I'd love to find someone around my age, perhaps a little older. Someone who is involved or even not. Someone that can understand the situation I'm in. Is that someone you?

I'm not looking to respond to an e-mail today and jump in bed with someone later. I'd really like to try the basics first. You know, the whole get to know you stuff? Kissing? Butterflies in the stomach thing? Yes, all of that would be a great start.

text:

Before the mundane chores of life and property taxes took over. Before we started bitching about the fact that the laundry is piling up!! When Saturday nights meant getting pleasantly drunk and going at IT all night. Not watching random TV and falling asleep by 10 pm. title: Making Up For Lost Time
text:
Well, I'm coming up on 30, and I've got just about everything I could want in life! But it seems like something's missing... oh, right, I forgot to date. Ever. Yeah, I'm 29 and never 'got around' to dating.

(If you're wondering how that happens: once you get to 25 without dating, you realize that you're already terrifyingly behind the curve in relationship skills. It's really easy to procrastinate after that - "just this one more aspect of self-improvement, and then I'll be dateable!")

So, I'm hoping to find a lady to be my special someone, and who can forgive my lack of polish when I use phrases like 'my special someone'. I'm attracted to women who are intimidatingly smart, have a sharp wit, and have intellectual and/or aesthetic interests they're passionate about. (And cute, obviously -- but I already knew you were cute, gentle reader. Unless you prefer to be characterized as 'devastatingly beautiful', in which case I concede that about you as well.)

Oh, and I hope you like museums. If you don't, I'm already out of date ideas.

Myself? I have lots of interests and hobbies -- all that time spent not dating, you know. I already alluded to museums; I especially like early/mid 20th century American modernism, and natural history museums. I'm also into cocktails, old anime, historic architecture, weightlifting, board games... you know, stuff. I'm a very even-tempered person. I get excited about petting dogs. I'm enthusiastic about trying new things, but I can't stand making other people put up with me learning a new skill. (A skill like relationships, for example.) I don't normally let myself write as cutely as this, but I'm writing anonymously on the internet and I have a cocktail, so I don't care right now.

It's not even a real cocktail. It's an Old-Fashioned, not that there's anything wrong with those, but I was lazy about it.

I'm paranoid about putting my photo on the internet, so you'll have to settle for the following: last month a former coworker told me I 'got hot'. Magnificent beard, receding hairline, I guess you could call my build stocky? I'd do well in the bear community if I were gay. I won't tell you I think I'm good-looking, because it's not my opinion that matters here!

Anyways, drop me a line if you think we'd get along well?

I shouldn't have to say the following, but it's Craigslist, so: I have a real job, I don't live with my parents, I don't do drugs, I'm STI free, and I'm not a Trump supporter. (Or Cruz, for that matter.)

title: Trembling knees, chills, and a racing heart in the bookstore
text:
Certainly you must have noticed me yet were playing your designated part and allowing me to make contact. I tremble and find my boots to be sculpted from lead. A large breath enters and exits my lungs simultaneously. I turn the corner as we pass out of the fiction section and enter the romance novels (thank you fate, I'll make note of this in my will) a little caught by what could be nothing less than a divine sign I fail to notice that you're stopped walking and my trajectory causes a slight collision.

We both giggle a bit and proceed with full force to the blushing. My heart races and stutters words that barely scratch through my desert throat. Like highway billboards you spot this with little effort and open the faucet top let your blush flow out. I am comforted by this gracious bow. We giggle a bit more in the rhythm of our voices dancing around small talk. Though entertaining, we quickly move to more sustaining conversation. We talk about the inability of contemporary art to have any staying power due to its lack of soul and humility. You notice "Hopscotch" by Cortizar in my hand and lose yourself reveling in the memories of Paris that you have. We toss around novels and authors like penny candy. Vonnegut, Robins, DeLillo, Bukowski. . .and simultaneously we both reveal our desire to see the Bukowski movie. Another giggle.Your mp3 player is still on and I overhear the end of "Englishman in New York" by Sting as it fades into Springsteen's "Lonesome Day" (his best). 

Of course, I have to inform you that at any given moment Miles Davis and Led Zepplin are out of their sleeves. And you say something like "oh my God, I thought I was the last soul to own both vinyl and mp3's in jest of course. 

In what is quite a bold move, you tell me that I have nice veins on the back of my hands as I shuffle to relieve the weight of my bag on my shoulder and in the process spill several pages of my novel/screenplay. And as I pick them up you are completely astonished that I am a writer-for you yourself are a muse. I have to spin around for a moment to test the reality of all this. You're still there as I come 360. Giggle, giggle giggle. And between the second and third giggle, right after the comma you reach out with your delicate unconscious hand and meet the back of my hand to feel my said veins.
The third giggle is swallowed as your eyelashes batter a bit. I crack a timid smile that hides the epic effort. Though foolish my heart revs up and races with fury as I pull out a pencil and search for a page on which to write your number. You have to run (and make your graceful exit) and I pretend I too must be somewhere else though you clearly sniff out my eighth grade lie. I turn and so do you. I want to look back and find comfort in knowing that you too are mounting an epic effort to not break.

If you took the time to read this long missive and liked it and are intelligent enough to know that I am a wordsmith who is extremely sensual, articulate, interesting and reflective. . .please tell me about yourself, include your heart, and send a photo.

50-56

title: A Much Nicer Climate For One Special Lady
text:
Only you know why you are wondering around the nooks and crannies of CL but if you are the right lady I have an idea for you.

It does not matter if this post is a week or six months old. I am running it in multiple US cities and I am renewing the post every 2 days until the right lady comes along. When she does I'll pull this post but until then, the offer is open.

I am looking for a lady on disability or SS or supports themselves by working from home over the net.
She has to be at least 37 years old but under 66 years old and still active enough to enjoy swimming and day trips. I might consider someone younger then 37 depending on her personality.
I'll Repeat Myself, You Must Be On Disability Or Social Security Or Have An Independent Income.
If that is you keep reading you might like this idea.
You can be White, Oriental, Vietnamese, Asian, Spanish, Chinese, Puerto Rican or Native American.

What I have in mind is to live together on a tropical island and be unique but happy couple.

I know, you're sure that your $700.00 a month makes it impossible to live in the tropics. Normally you would be right, but not this time. 

I am an older white male that has literally retired to a tropical island in the Caribbean. 
In fact I am just over 1,000 miles South of Key West. 
Bermuda, The Bahamas, Cuba, Jamaica, Haiti and the Dominican Republic are all North of Me.
I have the apartment, I have the car, I get a pension check.
I am proposing you join me here. 

If you are sick of cold and wet drop me a note.
If you are raising a child or grand child, that is not an issue. I like children and we have some 
good schools here. A brand new Elementary opened up last month and it is only a couple 
minutes away by car.

Most of the replies I get that were actually generated by a human ask about the need for a Passport. This is still part of the U.S. If you are born here you are a US Citizen. You do not need a passport to move here. I do suggest you get one because there are day trips available to a different country. Out in the morning, spend a day in the DR or British Virgins and back that afternoon.

I have gotten some replies that say they would like to move here but they have been in prison.
That Is NOT a problem. If you are not on parole or probation you can move here any time you want.

Of course there are things I am not putting in this post. 
Long posts do not get read. We will talk it all over in e-mail's.

All the pictures are less then 10 Min from my door.

The Caribbean never drops below 80 degrees. Most of the time it is between 81 and 84 degrees.
The temperature never goes below 70 degrees.

Liqueur sales is 24 / 7 and all grocery stores have a basic selection. 
If it is late most Walgreen's are open 24 /7

Gambling is legal here.
I have 2 nice casinos just a few min away.

The drugs, crime, prostitutes and gangs are all in San Juan.
San Juan is 3 hours away.
There is no mass transit or public transportation so the gangs and drugs stay in San Juan.

NO AFRICAN
NO MALES
NO HOMOSEXUALS
NO SEXUAL FREAKS KNOWN AS TG
NO PRIVATE E-MAIL
NO PHONE NUMBERS
NO PICTURES
NO LINKS
IF YOU DO NOT USE WHOLE WORDS DON'T REPLY
IF YOU LIVE BY TEXT DO NOT REPLY
IF YOU CAN NOT WRITE AT LEAST ONE PARAGRAPH DO NOT REPLY

IF YOU DO NOT MEET THE MINIMUM CRITERIA DO NOT BOTHER ME

Please change the subject so it says, "beaches"

title: Mature guy seeks love and friendship
text:
My ad has been running a long time. Why? Mostly because the responses, that is, real person responses, tend to be from those who are either to far away, just surfing, wishy-washy, unrealistic list of requirements or just plain scary and unstable. They comprise about 2% of responses. The other 98% is all Spam, hookers, Adult websites, and all manner of computer generated junk email. Welcome to Craig's List! 

He: SWM, healthy, blond, blue, 5'10", HWP (Height, Weight Proportional), semiretired professional, looking to spend some time with open-minded, creative woman to share fun and recreation. You can be slender and tawny to roomy and blush, I DON'T care. I don't smoke or do drugs, but like Earl Gray tea and homemade Margaritas, et.al. I'm Cal native, free and independent. Lineage: German-English-Irish. But, I'm mostly Californicus-Santa Rosan. I like most all music except the kind that vibrates my tonsils from the next car over. I like to beach camp in my tent trailer along the coast and do so every couple months in places like Bodega Bay, Wrights Beach, Gualala, Anchor Bay, etc. See photo above. Certainly would be nicer sometimes with a friend to share.
I'm happy, friendly, honest, open, humorous and usually a lot of fun. In short, I'm a desirable man of integrity and wit. I like music, the outdoors, the coast, exploring, top-down country drives and picnics, and enjoy a glass of wine at the beach or coffee in a morning forest. Just like to share nice times with an affable lady. And, best of ALL....(drum roll please)...You don't ever have to sleep with me! Although, you may eventually want to, because I'm pretty darn captivating (not to mention modest). I like good conversation but am not overly political. And, I also enjoy actually shutting up sometimes. Life is really all about personal preference anyway when you get down to it. I would like to fulfill some of yours. 



A few of my famous proverbs: 

Life is like a game of Horseshoes: Just get as close as you can. 

I don't have a problem in the world that money couldn't solve, and I don't worry about the 1% it can't 

If the ancient Egyptians were so smart, how come they couldn't paint a 3/4 portrait? 

Without guilt there could be no religion. 

If you have to say it twice, you're not listening. 

Life's two most important questions: 1. How much? 2. When?

title: There are options to your unhappiness
text:
Please let me know of I've left anything out. 

You are married, but the fire has gone out. There is no romance left. If you get any sex at all, it is to please your husband and you are often left unsatisfied. You are developing a more meaningful relationship with the washing machine during an unbalanced spin cycle. You are feeling lonely in your own home. You cautiously look into these alternative solutions hoping something might come to you, but you have never done anything like this. Society has made "affair" a dirty word. You don't want to do anything that might interfere with your family, but there must be more. You start to doubt yourself, 

"Maybe I'm supposed to live with this", "Maybe I don't deserve to be happy". "what have I done to get to this point "? 

I am here to tell you that you deserve to be happy. 

It is your husbands responsibility to take care of you and love you the way he did when you got married (both of you for that matter). Far too often, the man stops spending any energy on the relationship because he can get his needs taken care of in just a few minutes. But you require more effort. It's not your fault, you are a woman, and in my opinion, you are worth the effort. If you are certain your husband has no interest in rekindling your romance and passion, then I have these suggestions:

1. Find a Confidant - make friends with someone in the same situation (like myself) that can relate to what you are going through.

2. Take Time - there is no hurry. There are too many cons and scam artists on CL that you cannot tell who is legitimate. A quick test is to see how long their post is (1 or 2 lines are usually scams).

3. Develop Trust - get to know this confidant. Exchange many e-mails and share similar experiences to build a level of security . Make your confidant earn your trust.

4. Tease Each Other - share romantic thoughts, get playful with sexy stories. This will help you feel alive and remind you of the passion within.

5. Share Your Passion - If you feel comfortable, you can meet with your new friend and share the missing passion and romance that you deserve. 

6. Then look into the mirror, and smile like you used to. 

If you are interested in any of this, I would love to be your confidant. Feel free to ask me any questions. 

I'm here for you. 


If you reply, to weed out any craigslist scammer bots, tell me one one on the subject line that would make you smile. I'm hoping my name will make the list one day. 

Thanks for reading and wishing the of best of luck in your journey.

title: SWM seeks a female for genuine honest loving caring relationship
text:
Is the title enough to make you think this ad is fake? lol. I can assure you this is a completely real ad.

I seek a "true and honest genuine loving caring relationship". Yup, believe it or not, there are guys out there like this.

What do I mean about "true and honest" ? Well, to be "honest", I'm not seeking the typical run-of-the-mill relationship where two people meet just because past relationships have failed, and are now looking for company out of loneliness. I seek a relationship that's "true" to the standards of actually being in love and wanting to love someone in return. Honest in the sense of there being no lies or crazy hidden things. We are straight up with eachother completely. Don't get me wrong, I totally understand we all have our own past with things and people, I'm not saying everything has to be disclosed between eachother along the lines of "everything" , everyone has certain story's and experiences that are unique to them and will always be to them. I'm just saying, honesty and openness is there between us, "no bullshit" hidden, ...we are straight up with eachother as to how we build with eachother. Again, we are straight up with eachother as to how we
build with eachother.

What do I mean about "Genuine"? ....I am straight up me. You won't find me faking anything. I'm a what you see is what you get kind of guy. I don't fake who I am, and wont. There are exceptions though. For example, if your putting on jeans and ask me if your butt looks fat, ...well then I might say no. Truth is I love fat butt's, lol. Seriously though I do :-) Regular butt's are good though. I don't discriminate, I'm attracted to all shapes and sizes. Anyway's , back to the point, lol. Genuine, ...genuine as to who you are. No fakeness, no game playing, etc.

Loving: We all want love. Your just overall a loving person seeking someone to love, and get love in return, because you understand the awesomeness of the being in love feeling.

Faithful: Pretty simple. We are together to be with eachother and nobody else. We share a special connection and bond that we would love and cherish, and not letting anyone else come between that.

A little more about me: This part may turn you off a little because it's text your reading and can't hear actual vocal tones. But I'm just going to be straight up. I'm at a point in my life where I've never been married, haven't had any kids, and to be honest I don't know why. I guess that's just the cards I've been dealt. Never-the-less, I've been in a few relationships that were "Marriage like" , so I know a few thing about a few things. Here's where it might get a little harsh, but again I'm just going to be straight up.

.....I don't deal with bitchy, whiney, nagging, etc. Don't get me wrong, I'm not saying you can't express yourself, we all have feelings, concerns, and things that need to be communicated. But if I'm alway's being bombarded with complaint's about the stupidest things, and whined at, and nagged at, then this just wont work between us. Again, don't get me wrong, things come up, fights happen, and concerns need to be expressed. I totally understand that. My thing is "what's worth it"? Thoughts and concern's I'm totally open to hearing and talking about, but if I'm getting chewed out over something the size of a grain of sand, and it's been going on for 2 hours, ...ya, this probably wont work out. Example: If a make a small smacking sound with my mouth while eating food, and I only did it once, and it anger's you so much that you have to make 2 hour argument out of it, then I'm probably not for you, and your most definitely not for me. .....I've been in relationships where it's nothing but arguing and arguing and arguing, and to be quite honest I'm done with it. I'm not in a relationship to argue, ..I'm in a relationship to love and get loved back. I'm not perfect, but in all honesty I'm just me, imperfection's and all. I'm too old to be going through fighting, whining, nagging, bitching, etc. I'm not a control freak and I'm definitely not looking for one. I'm a simple guy. I just want to find a good woman that accepts me for me, as I would with her, and just enjoy the love as time goes by, ..getting closer and closer. Cherishing that special feeling. keeping things simple. Enjoying the awesome loving connection.

.....Changing me: I don't mind bending a little and making compromises. That's just natural in a relationship. But I'm not going to break my back for a control freak. At my age I'm concluded and accepted that I'm me, and anyone that is with me will just have to accept that. Again, I don't mind bending a littl and making compromises, that's natural in any relationship, and just life in general. But let's be honest, we're together because we like who eachother are, not to change eachother. 

.....Driving: I have a licence to drive, but I don't have a car. Why? Because I'm single and live in S.F. You don't really need a car here. However I have no problems buying or renting a car if absolutely needed. Until them I'm perfectly fine without a car due to the fact that living in this city is expensive enough as it is.

.....Sexually: I'm absolutely disease free and plan on staying that way. I'll stay limited to this subject, but I will say this, if you like day's where you just do nothing but watch movies, cuddle, and have sex, along with ordering some take-out, ..that's awesome!!!

.....Physically: I'm white, 36, stand 6 feet tall with nice green eyes and short dark brown hair. I have a thickish semi-stocky husky chubbyish build, but otherwise attractive. I'm not ugly at all, but I'm not some muscle head six pack ab's at the gym 23 hours a day, lol ..Again, " I have a thickish semi-stocky husky chubbyish build, but otherwise attractive".

.....You: I'm not too concerned about looks. What I'm more-so concerned about is that you truly understand where I'm coming from and share the same feelings for when it comes to that "special someone" your looking for. Aside from that I ask that you are disease free, physically very very clean, and just overall looking to make a true connection and build something special out of it. 

Am I asking too much?

Send an email, let's check out the chemistry and go from there.

title: DATE ,Coffee , A Drink , Movie
text:
I wonder if the magic spark can ever come back into my life? I often think about it........from time to time. Perhaps you might be thinking the same thing. 
Being a Single Latin Dad, I have to admit, I have been truly in love in my lifetime and there is nothing like it. Simply nothing. six five owe eight one four two six one two 
When a single parent goes year after year and doesn't somehow, someway stumble across someone , it feels like time is slipping away. 
My life is ok work, gym , eats , some sleep.. hugs, of course is missing however, if one really wants and needs that, it can be had...
Its funny but, it is finding that one person that when I look at her, words are hard to come out of my mouth. When I sit next to her, there is no need for words. Simply look into her eyes and two hearts feel it without one single word. Is it over for me? 
Is it even possible to find, or rediscover, and feel love again .
Is touching her going to be just as incredible as it once was in my life? 
Will my heart go nuts with a simple kiss? 
Will she have that effect on me?............Desire. 

How do we find that one? I Love dating.. When we were younger, it was SO easy to meet then let things all fall into place. Now, we put up all sorts of obstacles. 

My dream is to one day meet a female at a coffee shop and I find the courage to say, "excuse me, you are really pretty and I am finding it hard not to say anything". Would she smile, would she tell me where to go or would she simply look at me as if I was a ok? 
Do we go to a bar and flirt? Do we go to a restaurant and chat? Do we post something online? Do we try Internet dating? Who the heck knows? 
Me? I am a happy, well grounded, and content Dad. It would seem that I don't really need anything in my life. BUT, there is always that 'time', when I am alone that I think to myself, "could it be different'? I am stable, secure and most weeks, there are a couple of days I get lonely and find myself reading through these posts and wonder what it would be like to have someone come over for a drink and get to know each other. I think about it each week and do nothing about it. Today I am writing my thoughts on here. Obviously, there is a gap in my life. I have no clue what to do or how to do it........ I mean, filling that gap. 
What kind of Female do I truly adore? Being honest, that is easy for me to share: I love my female to be........... 
Stunning in my eyes both inside her heart and outside.... 
Extremely kind hearted, spiritual, and LOVES to feel true love........ 
Incredible at listening and communicating with everyone she comes into contact with.....
She loves and adores her family and ALWAYS puts them first..... 
She is well educated and a hard worker who sets goals and achieves them... 
Her integrity is through the roof and her friends/peers respect her..... 
She is down to earth, self-confident and can hold her own in any given situation.... 
as hers do
someway, bring her into my life, slowly, gently, most beautifully and most understandingly. 
True love. Is it still out there for those of us who are single ? 
If you took the time to read this dreary yet emotional outpouring, responses are not only welcome, they are desired.
I am ready to open up a part of my world that I closed off after my time in the USMC . Why did I do that? I am not sure . A relationship at times doesn't seem possible BUT, if two people can start off with a deep desire to see each other once or even twice a week, that alone is so much better than not at all or sitting at home thinking about it. 
Just thoughts and desires. I have often thought about using a dating site but have not done that. If you have done that and had success, please let me know which ones to try. I would like to be a great addition to someone's life. Especially if you are close to your parents. My family lives in another State and sometimes, that makes things pretty hard not being around them. 
Thank you for reading. I feel pretty nice getting my feelings out.As a Military Guy in The Marine Corps we are thought not to talk about stuff like this but I feel free now and I am to be able to write this , Although we may never meet, there is a tiny chance, we will. If you answered 'yes, that's me', to my little wish list, then we really should chat here. 
I am spiritual, spontaneous, ambitious yet non-materialistic, and truly try to seriously achieve all my goals. I am attractive, slender, caring, passionate, well educated and I have traveled a lot both here and overseas. I feel I have lots to offer the right female. So, to wrap this long thing up, what am I sure about? 
I hope one day to be wrapped up in someone's arms that I don't want to be without. When we ask ourselves one question, we get all the answers we need. That question is simple: Imagine my life with her in it. Now imagine my life without her in it. Which? 
Thank you kindly for reading. I hope I touched one heart that is in the same place as mine.
I leave you with one last thought......One heart. With so many people in this entire world, why, oh why is it SO hard to find our ONE HEART?
I don't want to give up on believing I can find you and you, me. 
YESTERDAY IS HISTORY , TOMORROW A MYSTERY, AND TODAY A GIFT. Adam R. A Romantic Latin adam95008atyahoodotcom

Think about what today might have been.

Your skin might have felt the warmth of his. The soft brush of his fingers. The hard pull of his gathered fist.

More than once. you might have snapped your thighs closed around his ears, your back arched, your hips twisting, your hands grabbing, flapping, gesticulating uncontrollably.

title: Very Attractive for Same
text:
When he first met her, she was a braided twist of nameless anxieties -- dark fears of the unknown -- wrapped around a core of aching desire. 

Unable or unwilling to say "no," but too frightened to say "yes," she could quiet neither her cravings nor her hesitations.

She needed time, she said. Time to "sort things out."

But life isn't like that, he told her. Life isn't a three act play; things will never be sorted out.

You take what you need when you find it. If you wait for certainty, the thing you need may be gone.

title: "It is our CHOICES that show us what we truly are...
text:
...far more than our abilities."
*THIS POST IS MEANT TO INSPIRE AND PROMOTE CRITICAL THINKING*



Thought:

To think. Craigslist and the whole online concept in general...and who it attracts. How people go online expecting a relationship (something in general) from those they have yet to meet (and spend time with in person)....darn those wants and expectations. 
Perhaps they are the same people who treat relationships like "cell phones". Never being dedicated nor appreciative for what is because all the while, they're waiting for the next best thing to come around. Meantime, they drop 'm (mistreat) yet RAGE at the "phone" or blame "service" because it does not work? Unless you have Metro, that is a sign of some SERIOUS issues and lack of responsibility/reality.



Then you have the ones who "only got on here to laugh at articles" (so they say). Let's just buy into that stupid excuse. You mean to say that your life is so grand, so great...you are taking the time to "laugh at the others" who are doing something most are not willing due to fear of judgment? Which is what: Put yourself out there in an effort to find something??? (whatever that may be)

..........seriously, why make a simple thing so complicated....

You are here for a reason. So unless someone forced you against your will (for some psycho reason), don't play yourself. KEEP IT REAL! For it will help you find some depth/meaning with what you seek.



Now, don't get me wrong. Some of these craigslist postings are hilarious but those are people purposely crying for attention...in a unique way...very unique. But hey, I don't knock them for trying quite honestly. It isn't easy putting yourself out there even when you may not know what you are doing or ever been forced to look at yourself.

No one hands you a book with "How to put yourself out there on Craigslist" and even if someone did? Who is to say it would fit you perfectly? There is so much to every one of us...so I'd like to believe...so how else will you know unless you try?


I would like to believe there are some who take it seriously and genuinely trying to find something from nothing which is not an easy task. Most start online because the judgment and rejection is not something everyone can take nor handle...especially when it is in your face. Direction can be questionable with some being too critical, impatient, inexperienced and some being too careless. So many possibilities... Is the direction/meaning in hopes of some kind of happiness? Maybe. For some it can be pure boredom (attention of some sort), unfortunately.


We all have different views though, so...what is "happiness"? Do we all share the same definition? Have we ever had a taste of it and if so, was it real or was it a compromise?


Well, we haven't a clue of happiness if we've never been sad or down. And hey, we have our reasons for reading these things...and I'm sure they are along those lines. If not, we would be busy living life and doing our own thing far away from this chaos, right? But I'll tell you this, there many people out there who have never thought to think this way due to denial/fear of reality. So don't fool yourself thinking because they've never bothered that they are perfect. HAHA! ...no one is.


"Ignorance is bliss."


Most people seem to be distracted from what really matters. With television, internet and bad family/parenting (lack of guidance/positivity), things have just lost their meaning with time leaving lost people to make their own - forcing the blind to lead the blind.



So "Craigslister"... WHAT IN THE WORLD IS GOING ON AROUND HERE?! Eh, we can go on forever with that. But you...what do you search for... and why?


I have been on here for quite a while posting this. It is all in hopes it will encourage readers to seek some direction or....discover a kind of hope. Let's just say I'm a nice guy simply trying to help. Because to know what I do now and NOT share it? I wouldn't be who I am today if those who came across my path never shared their wisdom. We are all just people trying to figure things out; ourselves and this world around us just to find a "meaning".


Craigslist has shown me that those who like to read are the ones who are most willing to try (more often than not). But care? Understand? Comprehend? That all varies by perception and experience. That is where it is important to educate yourself and take on certain experiences that will benefit your mind/body.


Here is something else I've learned:
The majority of visitors on here are searching for the best bull sh...illusion ever. One that has been fed by advertisements, fashion, maybe even some (ignorant/immature) family/friends and the entertainment industry... PERFECTION!


All the while you're making yourself insecure at someone else's benefit, You're left confused/distracted. Chasing dreams rather than the meaning of them...and what they even mean TO you. We care about what something looks like or what SOMEONE ELSE THINKS rather than what it's made of or how it makes one FEEL.


No one is perfect (that includes you & I) and the day you realize that, you will be one step closer to finding some sort of direction toward some sort of belief. After that will come happiness. Happiness will bring love from within but you gotta understand and find it within yourself. So don't go wasting your time on "looks" or "money" because time will diminish that...and what will you have then?


Understanding, compromise and respect are essential...and they truly start with yourself.


"You can't help me, if you can't help yourself."



Call me old school but isn't that what a relationship should be all about?

Helping one another? To help stay focused, on track, happy, healthy and being there for one another in hopes of betterment during hardships while keeping the other person's interests at heart? Or maybe better put: "Relationship: Two people who accept one another's past, supports the present and encourages the future."


I come to think of a partner as being in a "partnership". Saying, "I got your back and you have mine." Something... that took a genuine mutual belief that enriched bond or connection which fueled team effort in hopes of sharing one another's world (then a home) and prosper together.

Once that was accomplished, "traditionally" (not saying it's a MUST because kids are not objects nor does it make you "a real parent", "mature", "responsible", "respectable" nor "accomplished"), they would then raise a child or two (seriously, if you have more kids than you have hands, you have problems or you are a freak) to share what they have found in life. To keep that...that "fire" alive or pass something down? Maybe that is Disney stuff.


Again, not to say you NEED to have kids to be "respectable" or "accomplished", not at all. Honestly, many are not meant to have kids and best if they don't. I really respect those who acknowledge and make that choice. I feel finding someone you can grow old with and be genuinely happy is key. And that should not have to be "justified" or proven by marriage or kids. It should be by the effort and time together with all happiness to show for it every day possible.


...goodness! Sounds like a lot of work! But as they say (don't ask who is "they"):


 "When you love what you do, you never work a day in your life." 


Love, in my opinion, is about appreciation, not possession. So if you NEED to get married or have kids to feel validated? Something is seriously wrong and really must take a look in the mirror. 


Murphy's law:  "Anything that can go wrong, will go wrong." 



Maybe I have it all wrong. But what I do know and have right from experience, is that if you want something meaningful and amazing? It takes time, trials, effort and strong communication on both parts. Dedication that should blossom into passion. And anything that is fast and easy, is more than likely not worth having because everyone would have it. And if anyone can have it, I'm not sure if it'd be THAT special or meaningful. For anything worth having never comes easy.

So many people looking for "fast & easy" love...and look at where that has gotten most people? Welcome to single parenthood...thanks, mom & dad! (...it is always best to blame some on else...kidding but if there is anything, I blame marketing)



Dating will go as they come. If it's really fast... what can you expect other than it to leave just as fast?

(or be very fragile)



I wish everyone all the best and hope this all helps with some direction in your life. Because you came on and read these pages for a reason.


Note when reading these things:

The larger the post, the more you have to go by when you meet and see how full of shit they could be.

The smaller the post, you can expect the meaning to be just as insignificant (or spam).



Besides...it is better to say too much, then never to say what you need to say. :)



Want something real? Find out what that is and keep it real.
Because we all have hope. That's what TRULY brought you to craigslist. And when two people strongly believe in the same thing, that is called potential!


Just keep your head up or a good thing could pass you by for even I am still searching for my other half...I just had to know myself a whole lot better in order to get an idea of it. Weird though, because when I think about it? I never thought...that the other half of ME...has a vagina, haha! Maybe yours has one as well...that's cool too. Sucks for straight guys but hey, BE HAPPY!!


If you love what is true, the world will come to you but remember, it starts with yourself. And to take a look at yourself and make a change for the better is not easy, let alone accepting what needs to be changed but know you attract what you put out. Not all the time but: 

 "Real will recognize real." 


So don't be a fool placing "requirements", "limits" or "expectations" on love. Because love does not have a face nor eyes. It has a heart. It feels. And true love, is very similar to life. It's not something you "find easily" or ask for, it's given to you...out of no where. But ya better believe, it will take a whole lot of hard work and dedication which sadly, not many are willing to do.


 "Not anyone can be a great person, but a great person can come from anywhere." 





Thank you for reading. Much love and best of luck to everyone.





If you truly enjoyed this and would like to show support or keep up with more of these kinds of things to come (please be patient), feel free to look me up on book with faces and tube of you under "NESTOsterone".


I recently moved to LA to share all this in the form of stand up comedy so please be patient as I take my words of wisdom to the motherland of shallow!

title: Breast Therapy for "old salt" Connoisseur
text:
In trying to get over a heartbreak, I went to Paris, France.  World class museums inspire me, so I went to see the art at the Louvre.  Lots of art, lots of people. The mob in front of the Mona Lisa was a circus, but a little further I stood in front of Charles Mellin's "La Charité Romaine", and I was mesmerized. Eureka! The Roman Charity (google it!) The image immortalized by so many other artists. The story of the woman Pero, who secretly breastfed her father Cimon, him being incarcerated and sentenced to die by starvation.  Her selfless act so touched the Roman authorities, that they released him. I knew that painting, of course, but this time it got under my skin. After all, I am a man, an artist and a Pisces, and what I want now is the comfort and consolation of a breast (lactation optional), and a pat on the head, saying, "There, there", as intimate breast therapy to heal the heart.
----	About me. I am a European born gentleman seaman, chef, artist, and occasional poet. 73 oldish in very good health and currently single and living in San Francisco East Bay. I am a confident dresser and can carry a conversation in polite circles. Slender, open minded and open hearted, fun filled and a sensual kisser (discreetly away from polite company, of course, but really depending on how badly I want to kiss you). I am 5'10" and would love to practice the Tango. I am a friend of chefs and those who love chefs. I enjoy cooking for two or twenty, know how to navigate fine restaurant menus, but also enjoy a fine picnic hamper with a bucolic view. My friends in Paris charmingly call me a "Fine Gueule". I love foreign languages, performing arts, movies, theatre, galleries and museums, or just dreaming a day away on a beach or a houseboat. Not much of a sports fan, but I will watch key games on TV. Also, I never played golf in my life, but on the driving range recently I hit the first ball 150 yards straight out. The next three were bank shots, but there is hope. I am comfortably retired, volunteer for good causes, and make myself useful in many ways. I don't drink at all, but don't mind if you do. I have no major hobbies to hijack my time away from my woman, but keep finding enthusiasm (oh, look, a squirrel!) for just about anything interesting. When I love, I love romantically, with age appropriate passion and long lasting fun, slowly and fully committed, because I aim to create a life full of adorable moments. Consider me one of the exceptionally good guys by the name of Claus.
